title: partially_hairless_tail
body: When a character or animal's tail is not completely covered in hair or fur, but also not completely hairless as on a [[mouse_tail|mouse or rat]]. This most commonly appears on [[rabbit tail|rabbit]] and [[horse_tail|horse]] characters as a region near the base of the tail on the bottom side.

title: gurkha
body:
[b]Gurkha[/b] are various group of elite soldiers derived from warrior tribes from [[Nepal]] and some parts of Northeast India.

Known for their bravery, loyalty to their master and the use of the [[Kukri]], the Gurkha were hired by the [[United Kingdom|British]] after the Anglo-Nepalese War(1 November 1814 – 4 March 1816) after the former were impressed by the Gurkha's skills during the war. Notably being one of the factors that the British choose to keep Nepal independent during the colonial era in exchange for the Gurkha's service under the British.

Today, the Gurkhas still continue serving as elite soldiers in the British Army, Indian Army, Brunei Army and Nepalese army while also serving as a Special police force in Singapore.

title: heel_blade
body: A blade attached to the character's heel or their footwear.

title: rokubanchou_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students at Rokubancho academy in [[22/7 Ongaku no Jikan]]. Its winter uniform is also the [[costume]] for [[22/7]]'s 6th single [i]Kaze wa Fuiteru ka?[/i].

The [[winter uniform]] is a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[green shirt|green]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[black bowtie]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] (or [[thighhighs]], or [[pantyhose]]), [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. The [[summer uniform]] replaces the tops with a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]]. An [[emblem]] of 22/7 or ChouChou is sewn onto the left chest of the shirt.

In the game, there are shirt color variations such as [[brown shirt|brown]], dark [[blue shirt|blue]], and [[red shirt|red]]. However, no official arts depict these variations being worn.

h4. Examples
* !post #4844217: winter uniform
* !post #7655830: summer uniform
* !post #8563051: color variations

Being [[winter]]-themed, it features a [[winter uniform|winter]] [[school uniform]] heavily inspired by [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. Also inspired by Cardcaptor Sakura are the [[beret]] with a [[ribbon]] on top and the [[mini wings]] on the back of the model. On top, she has an optional [[pink scarf]]. Underneath, she wears a [[grey sweater]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] with a [[plaid skirt]], [[pink thighhighs]], and slouch [[socks]].

title: digivice
body:
The Digivice (デジヴァイス, Dejivaisu?), short for "Digital Device", is a device from the Digimon series based on the first Digimon product, the Digimon Virtual Pet, and it indicates that the possessor is a DigiDestined. It appears in every season of the anime, as well as the V-Tamer 01, Chronicle, D-Cyber, and Next manga, and several of the video games. Its primary use is to empower the DigiDestined's partner Digimon through Digivolution, though each version of the Digivice is also equipped with many other helpful features, such as radar or data storage. Even when Digivices are the same type, they are usually differentiated by a color scheme unique to the character who uses them.

h4. External links

* "Fandom article":https://digimon.fandom.com/wiki/Digivice

title: oma_kokichi
body:
[[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]] character.

The Ultimate Leader. He is the ruler of a secret society of over 1000 people, or so he claims. As he's a pathological liar and gadfly, Ouma tends to stir up trouble for the rest of the Gifted Inmates. Often seen with [[K1-b0]] or [[Gokuhara Gonta]].

He is a short boy with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] (sometimes stylized to [[purple_hair|purple]]) and has [[purple eyes]]. He wears a torn [[straitjacket]] with a [[checkered scarf]]. His initial portrait had him also wear a [[peaked cap]] and a [[cape]]. If he is drinking something, it will often be a [[brand_name_imitation|brand-altered]] [[fanta]].

[spoiler]In his former life, he was the leader of the [[dice_members_(danganronpa)|D.I.C.E.]] organisation.[/spoilers]

title: kiana_kaslana_(herrscher_of_finality)
body:
One of the playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. Released in December 2022, this is the last of Kiana's battlesuits to be revealed.

In her original Herrscher of Finality form, she is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] with pink [[diamond-shaped pupils]]. Her outfit consists of an elaborate [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] adorned with multiple [[black flower]]s, [[frills|frilled]] arm pieces, single white [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, [[single sock|single]] [[white socks|white sock]] on her left, and [[white footwear|white shoes]]. 

Her [[Kiana Kaslana (APHO)|Post-Honkai]] version replaces the neck flowers with a proper [[detached collar]] while her dress changes to a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] white-[[purple dress]] with white [[detached sleeves]]. Her tiara is likewise replaced with a black [[hairband]] tied to her left.  

Her [[official alternate hairstyle]] is a [[high ponytail]], while she gains additional [[blue hair|blue]]-[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in her Post-Honkai version.

h4. Appearance

title: vei_(vtuber)
body:
Polish-British [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Previously an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] heavily associated with [[VShojo]], she formally joined the group on April 9, 2021, until leaving to return being an indie on April 26, 2023. Originally streamed with [[3D]] models by [[jjinomu]], switched to also using a [[Live2D]] model with her fourth costume after joining VShojo. She is the (non-IRL) significant other to [[Silvervale]], having married to each other in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] in February 2021.

She spends a lavish portion of her income to commission lewd arts of herself and her friends, resulting in a great number of posts on the site.

title: energy_(pokemon_tcg)
body:
A [[gameplay_mechanics|gameplay mechanic]] in the [[Pokemon_TCG|Pokémon TCG]] and [[Pokemon_TCG_Pocket|Pokémon TCG Pocket]]. Pokemon cannot perform attacks without certain amounts of the right type of energy being equipped to them. They are also used to represent the Pokémon's type. 

They are usually depicted as spheres, with the type's symbol emblazoned on them.

title: dokibird_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] that started streaming in January 2017. She is a legendary thief per her lore, and commonly streamed herself doing art and playing games. Members of her fanbase are known as "[[dragoon (dokibird)|]]s." She has two stuffed rabbit plushies named [[Mei Mei (dokibird)|Mei Mei]] (black) and  [[Bao Bao (dokibird)|Bao Bao]] (white).

Her initial run ended with a graduation stream on May 14, 2021, but she later announced that she would start streaming again on February 8, 2024. During the hiatus she performed through [[Nijisanji]] as [[Selen Tatsuki]].

Due to the circumstances behind her controversial dismissal from Nijisanji in February 2024 and how public the entire situation became, Dokibird is much more open about her "past life" than most VTubers tend to be.

When streaming with [[Laimu (VTuber)|]], [[Mint Fantome]], and [[Snuffy (VTuber)|]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

h4. [s]Skinsuits[/s] Costumes

h5. Other costumes

title: pumbaa
body: Pumbaa is major character in Disney's 1994 animated feature film [[The Lion King]] and the deuteragonist of the 2004 film The Lion King 1½. He is a gluttonous warthog and the best friend of [[Timon (lion king)|]], a meerkat. Most animals are dismissive of Pumbaa due to his repugnant odor, but he remains happy-go-lucky by following a philosophy called "Hakuna Matata".

title: timon_(lion_king)
body: Timon is a major character in Disney's 1994 animated feature film [[The Lion King]] and the protagonist of the 2004 film The Lion King 1½.

title: rowan_atkinson
body:
Rowan Sebastian Atkinson CBE (born 6 January 1955) is an English actor, comedian and writer. He played the title roles in the sitcoms Blackadder (1983–1989) and [[Mr. Bean]] (1990–1995), and in the film series [[Johnny English]] (2003–present). Atkinson first came to prominence on the BBC sketch comedy show Not the Nine O'Clock News (1979–1982), receiving the 1981 British Academy Television Award for Best Entertainment Performance.
Atkinson has appeared in various films, including the James Bond film Never Say Never Again (1983), The Witches (1990), Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994), Rat Race, [[Scooby-Doo (2002)|]] (both 2002), Love Actually (2003), and Wonka (2023). He played the voice role of Zazu in the Disney animated film [[The Lion King]] (1994).
other_names: ローワン・アトキンソン

title: sisyphus_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Sisyphus[/b] was the king of Ephyra who cheated death twice and was thus punished to forever roll a [[boulder]] up a hill in the afterlife. Each time he reached the top of the hill, the boulder would roll back down, forcing him to repeat his task for eternity.

Sisyphus gained [[meme]]tic status in 2023 when the ending quote of Albert Camus' 1942 essay "The Myth of Sisyphus" went viral on [[TikTok]]. The quote, "One must imagine Sisyphus happy," was often applied over clips of video game characters pushing a boulder up a hill like Sisyphus, or other videos of people performing futile actions.

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme article: One Must Imagine Sisyphus Happy":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/one-must-imagine-sisyphus-happy]

title: tham_ngan_(ads)
body:
A Thai [[public_service_announcement |PSA]] encouraging people to stop drinking and work.

The video starts with a poor, alcoholic man drinking and shouting about being stressed and poor. He suddenly decides to stop drinking and start working on a farm. He steadily collects money and improves his life, transforming from a stressed alcoholic to an educated leader of his community.

title: yuki_miku_(2020)
body:
"Snow Parade ver"

The 2020 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was "musical instrument". The winning design by [[maple_(57675110)|Maple]] featured a [[french horn]] and [[band uniform]] motif. The official illustration was drawn by [[hanekoto]].

Her fan nickname is "[i]Horn-chan[/i]" (ホルンちゃん).

She has a [[mini shako cap]] with [[hat feather]], [[epaulettes]], [[fringe trim]], [[musical note print]] and [[snowflake print]] The accompanying design for [[Rabbit Yukine]] includes a [[mini top hat]], red [[bowtie]], and a [[horn (instrument)]].

Her theme song is [[pokapoka_no_hoshi_(vocaloid)|Pokapoka no Hoshi]] by Harumaki Gohan.

title: tteokbokki
body:
Tteokbokki (떡볶이), or simmered rice cake, is a popular Korean food made from small-sized garae-tteok (long, white, cylinder-shaped rice cakes) called tteokmyeon (떡면; "rice cake noodles") or commonly tteokbokki-tteok (떡볶이 떡; "tteokbokki rice cakes").Eomuk (fish cakes), boiled eggs, and scallions are some common ingredients paired with tteokbokki in dishes. It can be seasoned with either spicy gochujang (chili paste) or non-spicy ganjang (soy sauce)-based sauce; the former is the most common form, while the latter is less common and sometimes called gungjung-tteokbokki (royal court tteokbokki).

Place of origin: Korea
Associated national cuisine: Korean cuisine
Alternative names: Stir-fried rice cakes, derkbokee, tteobokki, tteok-bokki, topokki, dukbokki
Main ingredients: Tteok (rice cakes), Fishcake, Gochujang

title: apple_girlington
body:
[[Original]] [[Touhou]] character made up on the spot by [[Toby Fox]] on his Tumblr blog, in the piece '"improvised touhou music with annoying commentary":[https://fwugradiation.tumblr.com/post/13528293577/improvised-touhou-music-with-annoying-commentary]'.

As a result of her not having any art attached to her, only music, many artists have taken a stab at making a depiction of her. In the West, [[Mary Cagle]]'s version of her (post #4789490) has become the most recognizable design due to its use in YouTube videos reuploading the musical piece. Similarly, in Japanese circles, as a result of a Niconico reupload of the musical piece using it, [[Khylimei]]'s version of her (found "here":[https://www.deviantart.com/kerotohofan/art/Hahahaha-271664110]) has become her most recognizable design there. A third version, originating from [[Oligarchomp]]'s fangame [[Wonderful Waking World]] (found "here":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/File:AppleWWW.png]), can also be found in fanart.
other_names: アップル・ガーリントン

title: girls'_frontline
body:

Features personifications of a wide variety of [[gun]]s; or, to be more accurate, gynoids known as Tactical Dolls (aka T-Dolls), each imprinted with a different firearm, who don't necessarily personify their allotted gun (merely using it as a codename).

title: warupeach
body:
A scrapped [[Mario (series)|]] character, pitched during the production of the [[Mario Tennis]] series.  After successfully pitching [[Waluigi]] for N64 Mario Tennis, the team at Camelot (such as designer [[Aoki Fumihide]]) attempted to pitch a similar 'warui' counterpart for [[Princess Peach]], reaching the design phase for their second attempt during [[Mario Power Tennis]]. The concept would be rejected by Nintendo due to their belief that any design for her would not be appealing, or resemble [[Yatterman]]'s [[Doronjo]] (in part because of Waluigi's resemblance to [[Boyakki]]).

For years, her design wasn't shown to the public, with fans being inspired by the idea to create their own designs of Warupeach. On December 1st, 2023, the Power Tennis design for Warupeach (or [b]Walpeach[/b]) would be shown off to the public, by way of Aoki's Instagram, featuring the alternate name of "Priech" (プリーチ). The black-and-white concept art would be paired with images of an "in-color 3D model":[https://archive.is/fK3Ts] (rendering her outfit in purple). Aoki would go on to try and answer many "questions":[https://twitter.com/GenesisJam_/status/1730803149915472217] on Warupeach regarding design choices and personal ideas for her in the comments of the two Instagram posts, but would private his socials after being overwhelmed by the attention he was receiving.

h4. Gallery

* !post #6936894: The concept design made for Mario Power Tennis 
* !post #7362543: Example of a fan-made design

h4. External links

* Nintendo Life: "Random: 'Walupeach' Was Almost A Thing, But Miyamoto Vetoed Before Seeing The Designs":https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2023/01/random-walupeach-was-almost-a-thing-but-miyamoto-vetoed-before-seeing-the-designs
* IGN: "Waluigi Creator Reveals Scrapped Design for 'Walpeach' in Mario Power Tennis":[https://www.ign.com/articles/waluigi-creator-reveals-scrapped-design-for-walpeach-in-mario-power-tennis]

title: faceless
body:
When the entire front of the character's head is within the frame, but obscured or not completely drawn. Typically used on various background characters (such as a [[crowd]] of [[people]]) to deemphasize them, or on a "self-insert" character in various NSFW works who were meant to be anonymous and/or representing the reader/viewer.

If the character is meant to literally be without a face (not just for artistic style/due to concealed features; EX: [[slender man]]), use [[hole in face]] or some combination of [[no eyes]], [[no nose]], or [[no mouth]]. If the character's face is shaded but their eyes are still visible, uses [[shaded face]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[covered face]]
* [[faceless male]]
* [[faceless female]]
* [[head out of frame]]
* [[paper on head]]
* [[shaded face]]

title: sex_battle
body:
A fetish where [[sex]] is treated either as a form of combat or a "[[martial arts]]" technique, typically involves a [[battle]] between character(s) where either sides uses sexual acts to beat the opponent into submission. The fetish is, to an extent, a combination of the [[mixed-sex combat]] and [[zenra]] fetish.

Referred to as "battle fuck" (BF for short) in Japanese.

For an actual combat between male and female, use [[mixed-sex combat]] instead.

She has [[purple hair|purple]] [[medium hair]] tied up in a [[wide ponytail]] with a [[purple ribbon]]. She has [[green eyes]], and a small [[crown]] rests on her head. Around her neck is blue [[hood]] with [[bear ears|bear-like ears]]. She wears a white [[blouse]], a [[plaid skirt| plaid]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[purple skirt]], and a pair of [[black socks|black]] [[socks]] with [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]]. title: diabellstar_the_black_witch
body:
A [[Duel Monster]] and the main character of the Sinful Spoil card storyline from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]].

Diabellstar is a treasure hunter who seeks to collect the "Sinful Spoils", sentient magical artifacts with immense power. She normally has [[pale skin]], [[grey hair]] with [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[red hair|red]] and [[green hair]] on her sides, and [[yellow eyes|yellow-ish]] [[grey eyes]], though her right eye will turn [[green eyes|green]] once she dons her red [[half mask]] and using the power of the "Sinful Spoil". Her body is also noticeably more [[toned female|muscular]] than the other Duel Monster female protagonist, though this detail is often omitted in some fanarts.

Initially introduced as a calm and stoic character, but later cards reveals that she is quite expressive, somewhat hot-headed, and a bit of a drunkard.

h4. See also

* [[Like the Diabell]] (Teenage version)

title: jade_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German aircraft carrier [i]Jade[/i]. Character designed by [[Freng]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]]/[[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], single [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, [[white gloves]], and an [[Iron Cross]] badge above the cutout. Her [[rigging]] consists of a 105 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, two 37 mm twin AA guns, a [[flight deck]] with two [[aircraft catapult]]s forward, three [[key]]s, and an [[Enigma machine]]. 

She was originally laid down in real life as the ocean liner [i]Gneisenau[/i] before being taken by the Kriegsmarine in 1942 for carrier conversion. In [i]Jade[/i]'s case, her conversion was not even accomplished before cancellation later that same year while her two sister ships [[Elbe (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Shin'you (kancolle)|]] saw actual work being done.

title: daisen_(azur_lane)
body:
Personification and part of [[Azur Lane]] and [[World of Warships]] Collaboration.

Daisen is a combined version of a Battlecruiser and Battleship concept, designed by the Eight-Eight Fleet Program.

"In 1916, as a part of the development of the fleet, the Japanese parliament approved the construction of two battlecruisers in addition to the Kongō-class ships. That same year, Japanese shipbuilders presented four battlecruiser projects that differed in the power of the propulsion unit and individual armor elements but were all capable of reaching a speed of 35 knots. The six-shaft power unit became a specific feature. After a number of improvements, these designs became the basis for the Amagi-class battlecruisers."

Due to this, Daisen carried numerous and another one of the ships carrying the "Type 5 Bofors" for maximum Anti aircraft defense." Like Kii, she also has access to Torpedoes as her deadly speed and surprise attacks will make the enemy unaware of the situation.

h4. Skins
* !post #7856142: Default
* !post #8619807: [[daisen (bunny priestess in prayer) (azur lane)|Bunny Priestess in Prayer]]

title: bayard_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the light Cruiser Bayard, as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.


Bayard is likely a hypothetical and a later upgrade to the La Galissioniere and later De Grasse-class light cruisers upgraded with armaments and anti-air weaponry. Bayard wasn't ready for operation at the start of World War II, and with the defeat of France, the cruiser fled overseas. She finally found herself in the U.S.A., where she waited out the war. Upon her return to the French Navy, the ship was redesigned to confront modern ships like the Chapayev and other Cold War era of later ships in the 1950s.

h4. Skins

title: musketeer
body:
A type of [[soldier]] equipped with a [[musket]]. Musketeers were an important part of early modern warfare, particularly in Europe.

In popular culture, character known as "musketeers" are stylized after the French musketeers, who were typically armed with a [[rapier]] sword. This is largely due to the 1844 French novel [i]The Three Musketeers[/i], which codified them into an early-modern equivalent of a [[knight]].

title: gundam_sentinel
body:
A 1987 [[Gundam]] photo-novel that takes place during and after [[Zeta Gundam]] and into early [[Gundam ZZ]]. Details the story of a special [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] task force, Taskforce Alpha, pursing and suppressing a small rebellion of former [[Earth Federation]] military officers.

Originally conceived as an animated television series that would serve as a sequel to [[Gundam ZZ]], the project was canceled in favor of [[Char's Counterattack]]. [[Japan]]ese hobbyist magazine [[Model Graphix]], with whom Gundam Sentinel was co-planned, reinvented the project as a photo-novel and serialized the story in monthly installments. Strong fan reaction in favor of Gundam Sentinel prompted merchandising company Bandai to release a line of model kits based on the series.

Gundam Sentinel is primarily known for launching the career of now-prolific [[mecha]] designer [[Katoki Hajime]]. Also, Gundam Sentinel is the only Gundam property that is not fully owned by Sunrise and Bandai. Due to their involvement in pre-production, Model Graphix holds a copyright claim on the series. This makes Sentinel the only Gundam series that Bandai must pay royalties on in order to create merchandising based on the property, such as model kits or [[video game]] appearances.
other_names: ガンダム・センチネル

title: chikuma_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Chikuma[/i]. Character design by [[Shisantian]]. 

She had been present in the game since the beginning, but would be formally introduced following a [[Chikuma (old design) (azur lane)|complete redesign of her character]] in the [i]Upon the Shimmering Blue[/i] event. 

She now has a similar appearance to [[Atago (Azur Lane)|]], with the primary difference being her outfit (now featuring an updated [[black skirt]] and white top, with the [[detached sleeves]] now joined to the rest of the dress), her thighhighs changed from [[white legwear|white]] to [[black thighhighs|black]], [[long hair]] instead of short while still retaining her [[brown hair|hair color]], and the fact that she has [[rabbit ears]], which has led to comparisons with [[Arknights]]' [[amiya (arknights)|Amiya]] and subsequent donkey jokes.

Her rig was also given an update, now sporting four 20.3 cm twin mounts (one to her left, one on her back raised to the front, two on her right), triple [[torpedo tubes]], a seaplane, and a place to hold her [[ootachi]] on her left rig.

title: janus_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] J-class destroyer HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53). Character design by [[Mimoza (96mimo414)|]], voiced by [[Kino Hina]]. 

She is named after "Janus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janus], a Roman deity.

In-game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[light blue hair]] tied in [[braid|braided]] [[low twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[medium breasts|modestly-sized chest]].

Her outfit consists of a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] with a [[red ribbon]] holding the dress in place, [[detached sleeves]] exposing her [[bare shoulders]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]] with additional red ribbons acting as [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], and a white [[collar]]. She also holds a [[staff]] much like her older sister [i][[Jervis (Azur Lane)|]][/i].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 120 mm twin gun mount QF Mk7 and her bridge (and associated fire control director) to her right, 53.3 cm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] and a funnel to her left, held together by a hull piece to her back that contains her [[depth charge]] roller racks.

h4. Skins

title: halford_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the destroyer USS [i]Halford[/i] (DD-480), as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. While having existed in real life, she is depicted in her original 1943 experimental configuration as an aircraft-carrying destroyer.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] done in [[twintails]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[layered dress|two-layer]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], black [[frilled hairband]] containing her [[headphones]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life aircraft catapult to her right and her real-life forward 533 mm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] to her left. Her planes are [[F8F Bearcat]]s armed with Tiny Tim rockets that has floats applied for scouting and attacking purposes, launched from a teddy bear familiar to her back.

In real life, she received an [[aircraft catapult]] for a float plane in place of her aft torpedo mount and one of her main guns, allowing the ship to launch a Kingfisher scout observation plane. The catapult turned out not to be operationally suitable for the intended purpose and was ultimately removed from Halford in October 1943. However, in World of Warships, she get her catapult back while having her AA Defenses upgraded and she participated during Leyte Gulf. The Aircraft she carried are Floatplane versions of the [[F8F Bearcat]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: bruce_almighty
body: Bruce Almighty is a 2003 American fantasy comedy film directed by Tom Shadyac and written by Steve Koren, Mark O'Keefe and Steve Oedekerk. The film stars [[Jim Carrey]] as [[Bruce Nolan]], a down-on-his-luck television reporter who complains to God (played by [[Morgan Freeman]]) that he is not doing his job correctly and is offered the chance to try being God himself for one week. It co-stars Jennifer Aniston, Philip Baker Hall, and Tony Bennett.

title: the_mask
body:
An American media franchise based on the comic book series of the same name by Dark Horse Comics. It revolves around a mask that gives various individuals cartoonish and god-like superpowers. The individuals are ultimately faced with the challenge of overcoming the obstacles and conflicts they create while wearing it. It was adapted into a 1994 film, starring [[Jim Carrey]] as [[Stanley Ipkiss]]/[[The Mask (character)|]].

title: decoden
body:
The practice of decorating [[cellphone]] cases, [[handheld game console]]s, [[mirror]]s and other household objects with many different materials. This tag also includes [[nail art]] that uses an excessive amount of additional decorations, such as post #7865677.

Typically this involves the use of [[sticker]]s, [[rhinestone]]s, [[charm (object)|]]s, small cabochons and resin pieces, [[bow]]s, and more. It is also common to see a "whipped cream" effect.

It is a common activity associated with various Japanese street fashion styles such as [[decora]], [[yume kawaii]] and [[gyaru]].

title: gyaru
body:
[b]Gyaru[/b] (ギャル), also known as gal, is a Japanese [[fashion]] style that peaked in the 2000s. Although it has generally declined in real life, it still has many followers and remains popular in various Japanese media, particularily the manga & anime industry.

It has many diverse substyles, with some commonalities. Gyaru style typically involves styled and coloured hair, trendy and often sexy gyaru-style clothing (especially from the shops in the mall Shibuya 109), and heavy makeup, with a focus on false [[eyelashes]], enlarging the eyes, contouring, and circle lenses. Additionally, many gyaru use the "gyaru-moji" (ギャル文字) style of typing and certain specialized slang (ギャル語). There are also certain common hobbies among gyaru: dancing [[Para Para]] was at one time a very popular activity in gyaru circles.

Two common elements of gyaru looks, especially in anime and manga representations, are tanned skin ([[ganguro]] - especially for older or throwback styles) and bleached hair. However, not every gyaru has tanned skin or bleached hair, and not every character with tanned skin and bleached hair is a gyaru.

In mainstream media, gyaru are usually depicted as either an energeric or an extroverted character, while adult media depicted either as a high-school student [[prostitution|prostitute]] or a character with unusually high sex drive.

Male [[gyaru]]s are known as [[gyaruo]]

h4. Examples

title: takanashi_kiara_(fever_night)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]].

It's an 80's-themed workout costume based on the workout costume that appeared in the music video for [[Fever Night (hololive)|]]. It consists of an [[aqua sweater]] bearing the [[KFP]] logo, with a [[white leotard|white]] [[highleg leotard]] underneath, [[pink leggings|pink]] or [[blue leggings]] / [[yoga pants]], [[white leg warmers]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]]. She also wears a pair of large [[hoop earrings]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she wears her [[medium hair|medium-length hair]] in a [[wide ponytail|wide]] [[high ponytail]], held with a [[blue hairband|blue]][[bow hairband]].

[b]Note[/b]: Do not use this tag for the other outfits featured in the original music video, nor for the outfit that inspired this costume (as it has star print, not floral print). Do not tag this costume with the music video copyright tag either, unless the image is specifically referencing the MV.

title: azur_lane
body:
[b]Azur Lane[/b] is a Chinese shipgirl-themed side-scrolling shoot 'em up mobile game developed by Shanghai Manjuu and Xiamen Yongshi and published by [[Yostar]].

h4. Gameplay

Like [[Kantai Collection]], the game is set during World War II and mainly features collecting and controlling moe [[personification]]s of [[warship]]s from major participants of [[World War II]]. Unlike [[Kantai Collection]], it features side-scrolling shooter gameplay with mechanics akin to those of [[Touhou]]. Other gameplay elements, such as customization of a interactive backyard and marrying in-game characters, are also present. The real life factions are replaced by fictional counterparts (such as Empire of Japan being called as "Sakura Empire", United States as "Eagle Union", etc.)

Unlike KanColle, the game has made an effort to distance itself from WW2 in most aspects in order to appeal to a broader audience, pushing for most fantastical designs, the implementation of collabs unrelated to WW2 naval history, the release of shipgirls based on fictional warships without proper historical precedent, post-war era warships, WW1 warships, dark versions of its existing shipgirls (METAships), shipgirls from the Age of Sail, child and idol variants of its characters, and so on.

h4. Media

The game has been adapted into several manga and novelizations. [[Azur Lane: Crosswave]], a [[PlayStation 4]] / PC game, was released in 2019. A TV anime adaptation aired during Fall 2019. The game has also held an annual collaboration with [[World of Warships]] since 2017. [[Azur Lane: Slow Ahead]], a slice-of-life [[4koma]] series, was adapted into an anime in early 2021.

h4. History

[i]Azur Lane[/i] was launched on May 25th, 2017 in China, on September 14th, 2017 in Japan, on March 27th, 2018 in Korea, on August 16th, 2018 in English, and around September 2019 in Taiwan. As of 2024, the number of players registered surpassed at least 41 million.

h4. Tagging

Don't tag shipgirls with [[mecha musume]], [[personification]],  [[World War II]], or [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], unless these things are present outside of the shipgirls themselves.

Shipgirls of the same class may be tagged as [[sisters]], see forum #239409 and topic #24859.

title: knife
body:
A tool or [[weapon]] consisting of a short blade and a handle, used for cutting, stabbing, or slashing.

A knife can be a [[weapon]], such as a [[dagger]] or [[combat knife]], a utensil, such as a [[kitchen knife]] or [[butter knife]], or a tool, such as a pocket knife or a [[Swiss army knife]].

title: hayayakko_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Fast White (block of tofu)"[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Marshmellow. He is a white horse from the Shirayukihime lineage, just like [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]].

A long-time runner, he initially gained fame as the first white horse to have won graded races on both turf and dirt. His best race is the 2024 Copa Republica Argentina (G2), where he brilliantly snatched victory at age 8 (giving him the highest handicap) by catching up from the back with his chaser running style, winning by a neck against 1st favourite Chrominance.

title: regaleira_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the "Quinta da Regaleira":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quinta_da_Regaleira], in Sintra, Portugal, near Lisbon proper.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by Suave Richard and foaled by Roca. [[Stellenbosch (racehorse)|]] and [[Urban Chic (racehorse)|]] are her first cousins and contemporaries (they share a granddam in Land's Edge).

She is famous for winning the 2023 Hopeful Stakes (normally for 2-year-old colts), attempting to challenge the Triple Crown, then winning the 2024 Arima Kinen, being the first 3-year-old filly to win the race in 64 years, edging out [[Shahryar (racehorse)|]] by a nose.

title: sparkle_(fictitious_game)_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] of [[Honkai: Star Rail]]'s [[Sparkle (honkai: star rail)|]], exclusive to the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] collaboration event. 

Like her earlier [[Sparkle (It's Showtime) (Honkai: Star Rail)|It's Showtime]] dress, it is gothic lolita in theme and comprises a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[red dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, and [[black gloves]]. It differs in that she uses a red [[fox mask]] instead of a mini hat, she wears only [[single thighhigh|one]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right leg, wears open [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] instead of [[high heel boots]], and sports a [[teardrop facial mark]] instead of a [[mark under both eyes]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8623416: Profile

title: babylonia_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Seventh Singularity: Absolute Demonic Front, Babylonia[/b]
[quote]
2655 B.C.E. The seventh Grand Order.
This is the age when humans and gods first parted ways.
The Three Goddess Alliance, formed to destroy humanity.
A prophecy of destruction threatening to consume Uruk.
Facing ultimate demise, your greatest battle begins!
[/quote]
The seventh singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Set in the year 2655 BC in [[Mesopotamia]] during the reign of [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]]. In this singularity, the Three Goddess alliance end up summoning demonic beasts to overrun and destroy the civilization of Uruk. [spoiler]Over the course of the singularity, the beast [[Tiamat (fate)|]] manifests, serving as an even greater threat than that of [[Grand Caster (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

Released on the Japanese server on December 7, 2016 and on the NA server on December 5, 2018. It was adapted into 2 seasons of an anime by [[Cloverworks]], [i]Fate/Grand Order - Absolute Demonic Front: Babylonia[/i].

title: touhoku_zunko
body:
A [[Voiceroid]] (and later [[Vocaloid]]) character created to promote disaster relief efforts for the [[2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] dark [[green hair]] (with [[ahoge]]) and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[short yukata]], white [[tabi]], and [[geta]]. Her accessories are a [[pea pod]]-shaped [[hair ornament]], black [[muneate]], and a [[large bow|large]] purple [[obi]]. She is an archer, and her bow, like her hair ornament, is shaped like a pea pod.

She has two sisters: [[Touhoku Itako]] (older, [[UTAU]]) and [[Touhoku Kiritan]] (younger, [[VOICEROID]]), as well as a pet called [[Zundamon]].

Her [[VOICEROID]]+ version was originally developed by AH-Software Co. Ltd. in 2012. A [[VOCALOID]]3 version was distributed by the same company in 2014.  Later a [[CeVIO]] voicebank was made.

Her design was created by [[Edomura Niniko]], in the motif of [[zunda mochi]]. Her voice actress is [[Satou Satomi]].

h4. External links

title: zero_no_tsukaima
body:
Lit. "The Familiar of Zero"

A fantasy light novel series written by late "Yamaguchi Noboru":https://twitter.com/hexagonzero with illustrations by [[Usatsuka Eiji]], with a 2006-2009 manga adaptation and a four-season anime adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]]. The 22nd and final volume, based on a plot by the late author, was released in February 2017.

During a familiar summoning class at the prestigious Tristain Academy of Magic, [[louise_francoise_le_blanc_de_la_valliere|Louise Françoise le Blanc de la Vallière]], a 13-year-old second-year notorious for her temper as short as her stature and horrible track record at spellcasting (earning her the nickname "Louise the Zero"), manages to summon [[Hiraga Saito]], a human boy from Japan. While initially reluctant to rely on (and often disdainful of) him, Louise has come to accept Saito's role as her familiar, and soon develops romantic feelings for him, even as they help defend Tristain from enemies within and outside.

title: tastiera_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Italian: "(Musical) Keyboard". Follows his family's musical theme naming.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Satono Crown (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Partitura (from [[Manhattan Cafe (racehorse)|]]). Winner of the 2023 [[Tokyo Yushun]] (Japanese Derby).
He is a bay horse with a distinctive, roughly heart-shaped star marking as well as a pastern on his right hindleg and a sock on his left hind leg.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the horse is often drawn with his sire's [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]], especially in reference to the simultaneous ascendancy of Season 3's main cast and their RL progeny.
[spoiler]He is also directly refered to as the "Horse girl with green eyes" in Satono Crown's ending.[/spoiler]
If depicted as a horse girl, Tastiera will almost always have the distinctive "heart-on-a-stem" marking in the same way Satono Crown has her distinctive "crown" marking.

title: satogahama_school_uniform
body:
The school uniform worn by students of Satogahama High School in [[Hachigatsu No Cinderella Nine]].

The [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[white sailor collar]], a colored [[necktie]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] (dark [[blue skirt|blue]]) [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]]. The most notable feature of this [[serafuku]] is the absence of a chest part.

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a colored [[neck ribbon]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] (dark [[blue skirt|blue]]) [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]].

The colors of the necktie for summer uniforms and the neck ribbon for winter uniforms are as follows: blue for third-year students, yellow for second-year students, green for first-year students, and red for graduates.

title: kagutsuchi_(mythology)
body: Kagutsuchi-no-Mikoto (軻遇突智命), also known by other names like Homusubi (火産霊), was the [[Japanese mythology| Japanese]] god of fire who his mother [[Izanami no Mikoto|]] died giving birth to. [[Izanagi no Mikoto | Izanagi]] was so heartbroken by her death that he took out his sword and killed the newborn Kagutsuchi, dismembering him. From Kagutsuchi's remains and blood respectively, several mountains and deities were born.

title: trickcal
body:
An autochess-like 2D autobattler gacha game developed and published by Korean developer Epid Games. First starting life as an in-development dark fantasy chess-themed autobattler game titled [i]"Roll the Chess":https://youtu.be/8KJh2miy0ag[/i] in 2019, it would later be scrapped and have development restarted as [i]Trickcal[/i], a portmanteau of the words "trick" and "musical" according to the developer, with renowned Korean [[chibi]] artist [[Diyap]] joining the dev team as its main illustrator.

It would then officially release in Korea on September 27, 2021, but it was rife with launch issues so badly it would end up being set back to "open beta" status and then would later be pulled from service on October 3 in order to salvage what's left of the IP and restart development yet again. Diyap would later quit from Epid Games on January 19, 2022, and the developer would later find a new artist who could mimic his artstyle.

It would later relaunch as [i]Trickcal RE:VIVE[/i], parodying [[Cygames]]'s [[Princess Connect!]] Re:Dive, on September 27, 2023, 2 years after the initial launch. Despite setbacks and financial losses that could've ruined the developer a few months into the game's relaunch, "the CEO continued to invest in the game":https://www.khgames.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=235475, taking out loans when necessary, and ended up finding success within the casual playerbase after its first anniversary. The game is now preparing for a global release with additional Japanese voice acting, with its publishing partner seemingly being Chinese company [[Bilibili]] following a "Play Store leak":https://www.reddit.com/r/gachagaming/s/lwHlvhQFIa showing a test page for Trickcal's English server.

title: wombforce
body:
A [[meme]] originating from the [[Girls' Frontline]] community. Due to the robots of its world, otherwise known as Dolls, being modular in nature (with the playable T-Dolls featuring upgraded civilian-grade A-Dolls), players began joking about artificial womb modules that would not only allow the robots to have [[sex]], but to get [[pregnant]] as well. Epitomized by post #2993427, giving the module its name, the [b]Wombforce[/b], a parody of NVidia's GeForce graphic cards. When asked about whether Dolls could give birth, the official Twitter did "not refute":[https://twitter.com/GirlsFrontlineE/status/1070203475194073088] the potential of such a module existing, spurring further jokes.

The meme has since spread outside of Girls' Frontline, with references to Wombforce being found in fan works of other franchises featuring gynoids.

He is described in the novel to have a black [[mustache]] and [[black eyes|dark eyes]].

title: eos_(neural_cloud)
body:
Eos is a female character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].

Eos was a Greater Sanctifier of the Reverse Tower of Babylon.  She was created at the same time as [[lord eosphoros (neural cloud)|Eosphoros]] as a complementary counterpart to him.  As Eos and Eosphoros were created from the same template, [[Antonina (neural cloud)|]] describes them as something akin to twins. Before the events of the game she was registered as KIA.

Prior to her release as a playable Agent during the Entropic Dichotomy event, she first appears in the game as a disguise form taken on by Eosphoros.

title: nohara_misae
body: Character from [[Crayon shin-chan]], Misae Nohara (野原 - みさえ), is the mother of the Nohara family and its caretaker. She is 29 years old but she always tells people that she is 24 or 25. She is the classical housewife (専業主婦 Sengyō shufu) of post-war Japan - she cleans, launders, cooks, sews, mothers and lazes all to varying degrees of success. Her maiden name is Misae Koyama (小山 - みさえ).

title: mera_jin
body:
Mera Jin (米良 仁), known to SNK fans as Shiroi Eiji (白井影二), is a freelancer, comic book artist, and dessin drawing teacher who was previously hired by [[SNK]] near the end of October in 1992. Her alias originated from the alternate palette swap of [[Kisaragi Eiji]] from [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting 2]] (one of her favorite games at SNK). She is best known for being the main illustrator and character designer for the [[Samurai Spirits]] series. 
Her art while working at SNK were stylized ink paintings, made with dynamic brush strokes and characters posed with a subtle flow of motion. She is a lover of American comics (especially [[X-Men]]) and 1/6 scale miniature crafts.

h4. External links
* "SNK Wiki: Shiroi Eiji":https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/Shiroi_Eiji

title: don_quixote_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character. 

Sinner No.03 of [[Limbus Company]]. Based on and named after [[alonso quixano|the main protagonist]] of the 17th century Spanish novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]] written by "Miguel de Cervantes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_de_Cervantes. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]], [[yellow eyes]] that frequently [[+_+|sparkle]], and always wears a pair of worn [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]] with the name "Rocinante":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocinante across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but excludes the [[black vest]] and additionally adorns her uniform with various pins of famous fixers (Most notably [[iori (project moon)|The Purple Tear]]). 

She wields a towering [[polearm|joust]] in her base identity with the Spanish words 'SUEÑO IMPOSIBLE' ('IMPOSSIBLE DREAM' in English) written on it, the name of main theme song of [[Man of La Mancha]], the first official musical adaptation of Don Quixote.

[spoiler]She is revealed to be a second-generation Bloodfiend in Intervallo IV-2 after losing her shoes in a confrontation with [[Cassetti (project moon)|]]. Canto VII further reveals that she was formerly named [[Sancho (project moon)|]], having purposely wiped her memories by drinking from the River of Oblivion, suppressed her nature as a Bloodfiend with Rocinante, and adopted the name of the [[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|First Kindred]] that sired her.[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

title: miss_fortune_(league_of_legends)
body:
A human Champion from Bilgewater in [[League of Legends]] usually played as an AD carry. She is known for her flirtatious and confident attitude, as well as her pirate-like attire (despite being a pirate [i]hunter[/i]) and [[dual wielding|dual-wielded]] [[gun|guns]] "Shock" and "Awe". She has [[long_hair|long]] [[red hair]] and [[large breasts]].

Has a personal vendetta with the pirate [[Gangplank (league of legends)|]] after he murdered her family and left her for dead.

title: terminator:_dark_fate
body: Terminator: Dark Fate is a 2019 American science fiction action film. It is the sixth installment in the Terminator franchise and serves as a direct sequel to both [[The Terminator]] (1984) and [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]] (1991), ignoring the events depicted in Rise of the Machines (2003), Terminator Salvation (2009), and [[Terminator Genisys]] (2015). The film stars Linda Hamilton and [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] reprising their characters Sarah Connor and the [[T-800]] Terminator, respectively, and introduces Mackenzie Davis, Natalia Reyes, Gabriel Luna and Diego Boneta as new characters. Dark Fate is directed by Tim Miller and written by David S. Goyer, Justin Rhodes, and Billy Ray, based on a story by James Cameron, Charles H. Eglee, Josh Friedman, Goyer, and Rhodes.

title: murasaki_shion_(gothic_lolita)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Murasaki Shion]].

It's a [[gothic lolita]] [[cat girl]] costume consisting of a [[black bonnet]], a [[layered dress|layered]] [[short dress|short]], [[frilled dress|frilled]], [[pinstripe dress|pinstriped]], [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[black dress|black]] [[criss-cross halter|criss-cross]] [[halter dress]] with [[center frills]], [[dress bow|bows]] and a [[star brooch]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[juliet sleeves]], a [[frilled choker]], a [[purple pantyhose|light purple]] or [[grey pantyhose|grey]] [[print pantyhose]] with a [[chain print]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. She also has [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]] with a [[tail bow]] with this costume.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[twintails]] with a [[frilled ribbon|frilled]] [[hair ribbon]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4203950: Profile

body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Murasaki Shion]].

It consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[witch hat]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey shirt|grey]] [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical-striped]] [[pinstripe shirt|pinstriped]] [[cropped shirt]] that exposes her [[midriff]], a [[black capelet|black]] and [[purple capelet]], a [[pink bowtie]], [[black gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[lowleg skirt|lowleg]] [[miniskirt|mini]] or [[microskirt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs]], a chain [[thighlet]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] on them.

Her default costume was given the name [i]Virtual Magician[/i] (魔法使い衣装, [i]Mahoutsukai Ishou[/i]) in the [i]Azur Lane[/i] 2019 collaboration event as a skin since she uses an alternate outfit for her regular form.

title: matching_outfits
body:
When two or more characters have outfits that are the same, or slightly different outfits with remarkably shared themes and elements. This can be used when a character is wearing an [[alternate costume]] meant to match with the canonical outfit of another character present.

Sometimes, the outfits have [[reverse palettes]] with each other.

Do not use this tag for uniforms ([[school uniform]]s, [[military uniform]]s and so on) or [[idol clothes]].

h4. See also

* [[if lost return to (meme)|]]
* [[matching earrings]]
* [[matching hairstyle]]
* [[matching ring]]

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] with [[arched bangs]] [[parted hair|parted]] into [[twintails]] with [[double bun]]s and decorated with a [[black hairband]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[cat ears]] decorated with [[yin yang]]s

title: mahou_tsukai_no_yoru
body:
[b]Mahou Tsukai no Yoru[/b] is a visual novel, developed by [[Type-Moon]] and released on April 12, 2012. [[Koyama Hirokazu]] is the lead artist. The VN is based on a novel of the same name, which was written by Type-Moon co-founder [[Nasu Kinoko]] in 1996, but never released publicly.

[[Aozaki Aoko]] is featured as the main character.

title: over-kneehighs
body:
[[Socks]] or stockings that end just above the knee. In comparison to regular [[thighhighs]], they are shorter and leave a larger gap between the legwear and the [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in cases of [[zettai ryouiki]].

Judge length based on the distance from the top of the legwear and the knee, not the size of the gap. Combinations of certain clothing with full thighhighs can also produce a sizable area of exposed skin.

See post #86570 for reference, read the translation notes.

h4. Examples

* post #5776471
* post #2912271
* post #3512088

h4. See also

* [[kneehighs]]
* [[thighhighs]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
other_names: オーバーニーソックス
ガーターストッキング

title: kneehighs
body:
[[Socks]] that are knee-height, or just below knee-height.

Despite the name, kneehighs are usually slightly shorter than knee-height, usually ending a few inches below the knee, or at around 3/4 calf height.

If they're completely below shin-height, they're [[ankle socks]].

See [[over-kneehighs]] for thighhighs that reach just above the knee. See [[knee boots]] for knee-length boots.

title: soldier
body:
An [[military]] personnel trained, equipped, and [[weapon|armed]] to fight in a [[war]]. They usually wear [[military uniform]]s, often with [[combat helmet]]s and [[body armor]]. 

For characters which belong on certain special forces, use [[military operator]] instead.

Not to be used for random armed combatants or insurgents (even with [[camouflage]] attire), without clear context implying if they belong on the military or not.

title: mall_link_suit
body:
The [[mecha pilot suit]] worn by [[Kyouno Madoka]], [[Fin E Ld Si Laffinty]], and [[Muginami]] when piloting the Vox Units in [[Rinne no Lagrange]].

The suit consists is basically a [[bodysuit]] with a [[skirt]] on it. It contains [[see-through clothes|see-through]] parts on the back, shoulders, and upper part. These see-through parts become invisible when inside the Vox, giving the impression that the suit is actually a [[halterneck]] [[backless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]] and [[thigh boots]]. The inside Vox design is the one most used in illustrations, and as such posts are usually tagged corresponding with this design.

Additionally, the suits are individually designed the following:

* Madoka wears a [[green dress]] with no cutout.
* Lan (Laffinty) wears a [[blue dress]] with a [[side cutout]] on each side and an [[ass cutout]].
* Muginami wears an [[orange dress]] with a [[navel cutout]].

The upper borders of the "[[detached sleeves]]" and "[[thigh boots]]" of the suit also have a stripe of the suit's respective color.

h4. See also
* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: deva_battle_suit
body: The [[mecha pilot suit]] worn by DEVA agents in [[Rakuen Tsuihou]]. Consists of [[skin tight]] [[white leotard]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

title: miyatake_kazutaka
body:
[b]Miyatake Kazutaka[/b] (宮武 一貴) (Born September 21, 1949) is a japanese anime designer known for the mechanical design of the [[MACROSS]] series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]], [[Techno Police 21C]], [[Ulysses 31]], [[Crusher Joe]], [[Orguss]], [[Seisenshi Dunbine]], [[Gunbuster]], [[RahXephon]], [[Sousei no Aquarion]] and [i]Mobile Suit [[Gundam SEED Destiny]][/i]. 

Miyatake also designed the [[power suit]]s in the 1988 OVA [[Uchuu No Senshi]], which he originally created for the Japanese edition of the novel [[Starship Troopers]] in the early 80s.

A humble genius, Miyatake Kazutaka seems to be the most easily overlooked man in [[mecha]] design despite being a prolific artist. He has displayed a versatile style and attention to detail that is impressive to behold. Miyatake has been described many times as the silent backbone of Studio Nue.

h4. Notable Designs: 
*  [[Yamato (Uchuu Senkan Yamato)]] (spacecraft)
*  [[SDF-1]] [i]Macross[/i] (mecha)
*  [[Orguss (mecha)]]
*  [[Dunbine]] (mecha)
*  [[Gunbuster (robot)]]
*  [[Uchuu No Senshi]] ([[power armor]]s)
*  [[YF-21]] Omega One ([[cockpit]], [[mecha pilot suit]])

h4. See also
* [[Miyatake Kazutaka (style)]]

title: ex-gear
body:
A type of personal [[mecha]] armor from the [[Macross]] universe.

This advanced [[power suit]] appeared first in the [[Macross Frontier]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from 2008.

The [b]EX-Gear[/b] (Extender-Gear EG-01M/MP) is a special suit designed as both a reinforced-[[exoskeleton]] powered suit as well as an ejection seat/emergency unit for new variable fighters. It is even capable of flight on its own, with its miniature hybrid jet/rocket engine and large variable-geometry wings.

The military model (military specification EGP-03/05) is used by the [[VF-25]], [[VF-171]]EX, [[YF-29]], [[YF-30]], [[VF-1EX]] and [[VF-31]] pilots as an armored [[mecha pilot suit|pilot suit]] to tolerate the extremely high speeds and acceleration these new variable fighters can reach. It can be used by a VF pilot to control the fighter remotely.

Due to its high mobility in the ground and its high maneuverability in the air it is also used as a small personal combat [[power armor]] and as a highly versatile mechanized infantry support unit. 

There is also a civilian version (utility-type PS/ML-21) used for flight training and air acrobatics purposes.

In [[real life]] the EX-GEAR was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]].

title: d.va_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"I play to win!"[/i]

Real Name: Hana Song (송하나)
Age: 19
Occupation: Former Pro Gamer, Mech Pilot
Country: South Korea

A tank-class character in [[Overwatch]]. Once a world-renowned [[StarCraft]] player, 19-year-old Song "D.Va" Hana switched to piloting a [[meka (overwatch)|MEKA]] in order to protect her native South Korea from Omnics.

D.Va's standard outfit is a primarily-blue [[mecha pilot suit|pilot suit]] with a bunny insignia on the chest and sponsor logos on the right thigh; pink, [[whisker markings|whisker-shaped]] [[facial mark|facial marks]]; and a pair of [[headphones]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]].

VA: Charlet Chung (English), [[Taneda Risa|Risa Taneda]] (Japanese), Melissa Gedeón (Latin American Spanish), Tania Ugía (European Spanish), Geneviève Doang (French)

title: tohno_shiki
body:
Tohno Shiki is a character and protagonist of the Japanese visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]], its sequel [[Kagetsu Tooya]] and its spinoff [[Melty Blood]], created by [[Type-Moon]]. He is voiced by [[Suzumura Ken'ichi]] in the anime series, while in Melty Blood is voiced by [[Nojima Kenji]].

[spoiler]Tohno and [[Nanaya Shiki]] are often tagged together if the Shiki in the image is sufficiently badass. The jury's still out on [[Satsujinki]]...[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24287342: Original
* !post #8200527: Remake

title: white_len_(tsukihime)
body:
A [[Melty Blood]] character. A [[demon girl|succubus]] with a [[cat]] form like her counterpart [[Len (tsukihime)|]], she is also her polar opposite in personality and appearance. 

She is the familiar of [[Aozaki Aoko]], [spoiler]who created her out of the remains of [[Wallachia]] after his death.[/spoiler] 

Within the [[M.U.G.E.N]] fanbase, she is popularly paired with [[The King of Fighters]] character [[K' (kof)|]].

* !asset #24287436

h4. See Also

title: nanaya_shiki
body:
[[Tohno Shiki]]'s [[dark persona]] (sort of) turned distinct character thanks to the [i][[Melty Blood]][/i] games, mostly distinguished from [[Tohno Shiki]] by the look in his eyes and the amount of smugness. Usually tagged as both characters unless there is good evidence to the contrary--for instance, [[White Len (tsukihime)|]] only hangs around Nanaya, and Nanaya doesn't wear glasses.

[spoiler]This was Toono Shiki's original name before he took [[Tohno Shiki (2)]]'s place.[/spoiler]

title: riesbyfe_stridberg
body:
[[Melty Blood]] character.

She is a friend of [[Sion Eltnam Atlasia]] and died rescuing her from [[Wallachia]] during her last manifestation prior to Melty Blood.

In the [[Yumizuka Satsuki]] and Sion routes of Actress Again, she continues to live after the destruction of the [[Dust of Osiris]] and joins the Back Alley Alliance. 

She wields the Conceptual Weapon [[True Apocrypha]] AKA Spear Key and Gun Shield, a [[pile bunker]] shaped like a [[cello]].

title: berrypheasant_skewer_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: [[Honkai: Star Rail]]'s equivalent of 糖葫芦 ([i]tanghulu[/i]), which are candied fruits (traditionally Chinese hawthorn) on a bamboo skewer. They are usually depicted as being ball-shaped and orange-brown in color, with two to five per skewer. A favorite food of [[Yunli (Honkai: Star Rail)|]].

title: wallachia
body:
Also known as [b]TATARI[/b] (タタリ, curse). Dead Apostle Ancestor No. 13. His real name was Zepia Eltnam Oberon, an alchemist from Atlas. 

Has the power to grant physical form to fears using his Reality Marble, [b]The Night of Wallachia[/b]. He has no definite form, although he was commonly seen in the form of a traditional [[vampire]].

title: ryougi_shiki
body:
Ryougi Shiki is one of the main protagonists of the [[Kara no Kyoukai]] novels. She is a teenage girl who possesses the [[Mystic Eyes of Death Perception]], a supernatural ability that allows the user to see the inherent mortality of everything (both living and non-living) in the form of lines.

She has short [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She is usually seen wearing a [[red jacket|red]] [[leather jacket]] over a [[blue kimono]]. When she uses her powers, her eyes [[glowing eyes|glow]] an iridescent [[blue eyes|blue]] (though she is sometimes illustrated with blue eyes while [i]not[/i] using her powers [[artistic error|by mistake]]).

During the [[Fate/Grand Order]] collaboration event with Kara no Kyoukai, she can be acquired as an Assassin-class Servant. 

[spoiler]Her [[Void Shiki|third personality]] (aka the embodiment of the Void) can also be summoned as a Saber-class Servant. This version of hers wields the Kanesada Kuji, and as she gains power, her hair grows out, her kimono grows more elaborate, and has the Mystic Eyes of Death Perception activated permanently.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakamoto Maaya]]

h4. Official Art

* !post #854892

h4.Outfits

* [[ryougi shiki (decapitating bunny)|Decapitating Bunny]]
* [[ryougi shiki (second ascension)|Second Ascension]]
* [[ryougi shiki (third ascension)|Third Ascension]]

* http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Ryougi_Shiki

title: len_(tsukihime)
body:
A character from [[TYPE-MOON]]'s [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]] series, first appearing in [[Kagetsu Tooya]]. Len (or Ren) is a dream-manipulating [[demon girl|succubus]] by nature, and can turn into a [[cat]], [[a cat is fine too (meme)|which is fine, too]]. 

Portrayed as a girl with [[long hair|long]], [[blue hair]]; [[red eyes|red]] [[empty eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. She tends to be mute, rarely ever speaking in her humanoid form. 

She serves [[Tohno Shiki]] as a familiar.

title: artoria_pendragon_(fate)
body:
[b]Altria Pendragon[/b] (also known by the popular fan romanization as [b]Artoria Pendragon[/b]) is a character from the [[Fate (series)|]] series, and the [i]de facto[/i] mascot of the series.

She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[King Arthur (mythology)|]] from the old English mythology, manifested as a "Servant", powerful manifestation of historical/mythological figures in the Fate universe.

She and her variants, with the exception of Arthur Pendragon, are voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She first appeared in [[Fate/stay night]] as [[Saber (fate)|]], but later went on to appear in many other forms throughout the [[Fate (series)|]] series. This tag is an umbrella tag that collects all versions of Artoria Pendragon under one tag.

h4. Variations

* [[Saber (fate)|]] - Original version from [[Fate/stay night]].
* [[Saber Alter]] - [[Yellow eyes]], wears black armor or [[gothic lolita]] apparel. No [[ahoge]].
* [[Santa Alter]] - The above as Rider class, wearing a Christmas-themed outfit and a [[santa hat]].
* [[Saber Lily]] - [[Ponytail]], white clothing, [[bare back]].
* [[Saber Lion]] - Saber in a [[lion costume]].
* [[Sader]] - Based on a nightmarishly horrible figure.
* [[Saver (fate/prototype)|]] - Original character design as a male.
* [[Arthur Pendragon (Fate)|]] - Male Saber from [[Fate/Prototype]].
* [[Artoria Caster (fate)|]] - Caster class. Uses either Chastiefol or Marmyadose instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (fate)|]] - Lancer class. Sports [[large breasts]] and [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer Alter) (fate)|]] - Alter version of the above.
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Swimsuit Ruler) (Fate)|]] - Ruler version of the above.
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Swimsuit Archer) (fate)|]] - Archer class version of the original Saber.
* [[Artoria Pendragon (Alter Swimsuit Rider) (fate)|]] - Rider class version of Saber Alter.
* [[Master Artoria]] - Wears a blue [[serafuku]], wields a katana and has a Command Spell on her right hand. 
* [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]] - Assassin class, wears sporty clothes and a baseball cap.
* [[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (fate)|]] - Berserker class, wears various outfits and wields a lightsaber-esque blade.
* [[Mysterious Heroine XX (Fate)|]] - Foreigner class, wears either a mecha suit and scarf or a bikini, cropped jacket and baseball cap.
* [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]] - Foreigner class, wields a guitar and speakers.
* [[Ultra Heroine Z (fate)|]]

h4. See also

Despite their names and very similar appearances, these characters are considered to be separate characters from Artoria Pendragon.

* [[Nero Claudius (Fate)|]] (Saber Extra)
* [[Mordred (Fate)|]] (Saber of Red)
* [[Okita Souji (Fate)|]] (Sakura Saber)
other_names: アルトリア・ペンドラゴン

title: lynette_bishop
body:
Lynette Bishop (リネット・ビショップ) is a character from [[Strike Witches]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and light [[brown hair]], worn in a [[single braid]]. Her uniform is a jacket over a [[sweater vest]]. Her familiar is a Scottish Fold cat. She also has a sister, [[Wilma Bishop]].

Her pilot archetype is unclear, but is likely one of the children of famed Canadian WWI pilot "Billy Bishop":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Bishop, who is the pilot archetype for Minnie Bishop, Lynette's mother. Lynette also has an older sister, Wilma, who is also a Witch, and likely based on Billy Bishop's son, Arthur. Although based on a Canadian, Lynette is officially said to be from Brittania.

h4. Equipment

* [[boys anti tank rifle|Mk. I Boys Anti-tank Rifle]]
* [[machine gun|Bren light machine gun]]
other_names: リネット・ビショップ

title: jojo_pose
body:
The [b]JoJo pose[/b] refers to the signature poses of the protagonists and some supporting characters on the covers and in the panels of [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s manga, [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. These poses are commonly referenced in other anime and manga due to how overly dramatic and/or [[FABULOUS]] the poses can be.

This tag encompasses various "JoJo poses" seen within the series, ranging from the one done by the the main characters to some lesser known ones without its own tags. If the pose is the one with tags (as seen below), then apply both this tag and the specific pose's tag.

h4. Poses with tags

title: mega_man_1
body:
[b]Rockman[/b], known as [b]Mega Man[/b] outside of Japan, is a 1987 2D action-platform [[video game]] developed and published by [[Capcom]] for the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]]/Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). 

It was directed by Kitamura Akira, with Matsushima Nobuyuki as lead programmer, and is the first game of the Mega Man franchise and the original video game series. Mega Man was produced by a small team specifically for the home [[game console]] market, a first for Capcom, who previously focused on [[arcade]] titles.

The game begins the struggle of the [[android]] and player-character [[Mega Man (character)|]] against the mad scientist [[Dr. Wily (mega man)|]] and the six "Robot Masters" under his control. Mega Man's nonlinear gameplay lets the player choose the order in which to complete its initial six stages. Each culminates in a boss battle against one of the Robot Masters that awards the player-character a unique weapon. Part of the strategy of the game is that the player must carefully choose the order in which to tackle the stages so that they can earn the weapons that will be most useful for future stages.

Critics praised Mega Man for its overall design, though the game was not a commercial success. Mega Man established many of the gameplay, story, and graphical conventions that would define the ensuing sequels, subseries, and spin-offs in the [[Mega Man (classic)|]] franchise. 

The first game has since been featured in game compilations, including Mega Man Legacy Collection for Windows, [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], [[Nintendo 3DS]], and [[Nintendo Switch]], rereleased on mobile phones, and become a part of console emulation services. It received a full 3D remake titled [[Mega Man: Powered Up]] in 2006.

title: proto_man
body:
Known as Blues in Japan, he is the first Robot Master ever created by [[Dr. Light (mega man)|]] (DLN-000), even before [[Mega Man (character)|]] himself. Considered the "older brother" of Mega Man and [[Roll (mega man)|]], he is a lone wolf and a rival-mentor to Mega Man. He first appeared in [[Mega Man 3]].

title: megumin
body:
Character in [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!]]

Peculiarly named young arch-mage that really likes to cast "EXPLOSION" daily. Megumin has [[red eyes]] but wears an [[eyepatch]] over her left eye [spoiler]for no particular reason[/spoiler], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]] [[short_hair_with_long_locks|hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]]. She also wears a [[short dress|short]] [[off-shoulder dress|off-shoulder]] [[red dress]] most of the time, a [[black choker| black]] [[choker]], [[black gloves| black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a large [[brown belt|brown]] [[belt]] and a [[single thighhigh| single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]], while her other leg is [[bandaged leg|bandaged]], under [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[brown footwear|brown]] [[knee boots]]. Mostly she wears a [[black hat| black]] [[witch hat]] that has dot eyes sewn on it.

When she attended school in her hometown, she typically wore her [[Red Prison Magic School uniform]], featuring a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[red_necktie|red]] and [[orange_necktie|orange]] [[diagonal-striped_necktie|diagonally-striped]] [[necktie]], and a long [[black_robe|black]] [[robe]] with [[wide sleeves]], a [[two-sided_fabric|red lining]].

She has a [[winged cat|winged]] [[black cat|black]] [[cat]] named [[Chomusuke]]. Her younger sister is [[Komekko]].

title: hazard_(overwatch)
body:
A character in [[Overwatch 2]].

A Scottish tank-class hero. Hazard had a rough childhood as he grew up in poverty, his mother passing away at a young age, a neglectful father, and being bullied at school. During his time the military, an Overwatch jet was shot out of the air by a Talon ship. It crashed into his apartment, killing his father, and burying him under rubble. He survived, but he ended up a [[triple amputee]], ultimately ending his military career. Scorned by the incident and receiving bare minimum support from the government, he turned to an underground rebel group called the Phreaks.


Real Name: Findlay Docherty
Birthday: November 11
Age: 24
Voiced by: [[Conor McLeod]] 

h4. External Links

* "Overwatch Wiki: Hazard":[https://overwatch.fandom.com/wiki/Hazard]

title: ciel_(tsukihime)
body:
A character in the visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]], who also makes an appearance in the 2d fighting game [[Melty Blood]].

She is voiced by [[Orikasa Fumiko]] in the original Tsukihime anime, by [[Wendee Lee]] in the English dub, [[Sakuma Kumi]] in Melty Blood, and [[Hondo Kaede]] in the [[Tsukihime (remake)|2021 remake]]. Ciel also makes an appearance in [[Kagetsu Tooya]] as [[ciel-sensei|Ciel Sensei]], where she acts as a teacher to various Tsukihime characters, among them [[Neco-Arc]].

Her birthday is May 3rd. Her height is 165, weighs 52 kg with a blood type of O. Her three sizes are B85/W56/H88. She appears to be a teenager, but her true age is much older, and unknown.

In the original Tsukihime she has [[curtained hair]], whereas in the remake she has [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]].

title: loitering_munition
body:
A loitering munition, also known as a [[suicide]] [[drone]], is a kind of aerial [[weapon]] with a built-in [[explosive|warhead]] that is typically designed to loiter around a target area until a target is located, then attack the target by crashing into it. Loitering munitions enable faster reaction times against hidden targets that emerge for short periods without placing high-value platforms near the target area and also allow more selective targeting as the attack can be changed mid-flight or aborted.

h4. External links: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loitering_munition

title: shahryar_(racehorse)
body:
<tn>Persian: "Great King". This is the name of [[shahrayar|the main antagonist]] in the frame story of [[Arabian Nights]].</tn>

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Dubai Majesty.

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 Generation, he is the winner of the 2021 Japanese Derby ([[Tokyo Yushun]]). He also gained fame by winning the 2022 Dubai Sheema Classic but ended up slumping afterwards. A frequent traveller, he raced in Dubai (3 times), in the United States (twice) and in Great Britain (once).

He retired after the 2024 Arima Kinen, making him the last of his generation's classics to retire, but not before making an effort to win the race starting from the outside gate. He only lost by a nose to [[Regaleira (racehorse)|]].

title: terminator_genisys
body: Terminator Genisys is a 2015 American cyberpunk action film that is the fifth installment in [[the Terminator]] franchise. It is a reboot of the franchise, taking the premise of the original film in another direction and ignoring the events depicted in sequels and the TV series.
other_names: ターミネーター:新起動/ジェニシス

title: terminator_3:_rise_of_the_machines
body: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines[a] is a 2003 science fiction action film, the third installment in [[the Terminator]] franchise and a sequel to [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]] (1991). It is directed by Jonathan Mostow and stars [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], Nick Stahl, Claire Danes, and Kristanna Loken. In its plot, the malevolent artificial intelligence Skynet sends a T-X (Loken)—a highly advanced Terminator—back in time to ensure the rise of machines by killing top members of the future human resistance as John Connor's (Stahl) location is unknown. The resistance sends back a reprogrammed T-850 (Schwarzenegger) to protect John and Kate (Danes).

title: terminator_(series)
body:
A media franchise originating from an American science fiction film series about a post-apocalyptic war between an artificial intelligence called Skynet and the survivors of the human race. Both sides use time travel in an attempt to stop or win the war before it happens. Major stars in one or more films in the series include [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] as the titular Terminator (an antagonist in the first film but a protagonist after) and Linda Hamilton and Emilia Clarke as Sarah Connor.

Six movies have been produced: [[The Terminator]] (1984), [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]] (1991), [[Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines]] (2003), Terminator Salvation (2009), [[Terminator Genisys]] (2015), and [[Terminator: Dark Fate]] (2019). Also, a TV series based on the same universe called [[Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles]] was released in 2008.

He is often seen in a [[black jacket]] and [[black cloak]]. His signature trait is his [[red hair|red]] [[colored tips]], and he’s associated with [[fire]].

body:

He notably has [[lion ears]]. He wears [[shoulder armor]], [[red cape]], a [[pendant]], and his [[midriff]] is exposed.

title: nil_lars
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, [[Lars Rorschach]]’s alternate self in the Spirit World. The Lord of Light, ruler of the Light Era, and the most powerful Spirit Lord by being the one closest to “god”. He forces the [[heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] to enter a ritual with him in the name of saving the Spirit World from its impending apocalypse. 

He notably has [[dark skin]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]]. He wears an [[open coat|open]] [[red coat]], [[open robe|open]] [[white robe]], [[white pants]], [[sandals]], and [[circlet]]. 

h4. See also
* [[Sol Lars]] (twin brother)

title: kaiba_seto
body:
[[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] character. [[Muto Yugi]]'s biggest rival and largely believed to be the anti-hero of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]]. 

He and his younger brother [[Kaiba Mokuba]] were adopted from an orphanage by Gozaburo Kaiba. Arrogant and power-driven, he believes that he is the best duelist in the world. Seto took over his stepfather's company Kaiba Corporation at a young age and became the president of Kaiba Corp, turning it from a major arms dealer to the biggest gaming company in the world of [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] and among the most influential in the United States.

His signature monster is the [[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]]. He is obsessed with it to the point where he includes his motif on everything he owns.

h4. See also
* [[Priest Seto]] - Kaiba's ancient Egyptian incarnation
* [[Kaiba's defeat (meme)]]

title: captain_titus
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[warhammer 40k: space marine|Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine I and II]], Captain (later Lieutenant) Demetrian Titus served as the commander of the [[Ultramarines]]' Second Company until the events of the first [i]Space Marine[/i] game saw him taken into the custody of the [[Inquisition]]. After being released following his captivity, Titus, assuming that his chapter had expunged his records given the circumstances of his detainment, would join the [[Deathwatch]] as a Blackshield. A botched mission against the [[tyranid|Tyranids]] would see him mortally wounded and turned into a Primaris Marine in order to survive. Afterwards, he would rejoin the Ultramarines (who had never forgotten him at all) with honors, though his absence would see him reinstated as a Lieutenant with Second Company having long been under new command.

He is known for his more lax attitude towards the [i]Codex Astartes[/i] and his high resistance to the effects of the Warp and Chaos, the later of which has seen suspicion repeatedly cast upon him.

title: frostleaf_(arknights)
body:
[i]Frostleaf, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, will obey all your orders.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Former Junior Army solder, after her unit was destroyed she led a  mercenary life, until she joined Rhodes Island as an operator.

She can cast freezing-type Arts and, as a mercenary, she once fought [[Dur-Nar (arknights)|]].

She likes to wear trendy clothes and listen to music alone.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kakuma Ai]] (Japanese), Ruan Congqing (Chinese), Ina Marie Smithe (English), and Jang Mi (Korean). Her art designer is [[xiayehongming]].
