title: jesse_pinkman
body:
Deuteragonist of the American crime drama television series [[Breaking Bad]]. Jesse partners with his former high school chemistry teacher [[Walter White]] to cook and sell methamphetamine.

Seen early in the series with a [[beanie]] obscuring [[short hair|short]], [[brown hair]]. Also frequently wearing a [[hoodie]] and any number of graphic [[shirt|shirts]].

Later in the series, he shaves his head and takes on a less eccentric wardrobe, largely ditching his beanies as well.

He was portrayed by Aaron Paul. Jesse is the only character besides Walter to appear in every episode of the show. Paul reprised the role for the 2019 spin-off sequel film El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie, set after its finale, and again in 2022 for the sixth and final season of the spin-off prequel sequel series [[Better Call Saul]], being one of the few characters to appear across both shows and the movie.
other_names: ジェシー・ピンクマン

title: oo_ee_a_e_a_(meme)
body:
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/oo-ee-a-e-a-tiktok-sound
Oo Ee A E A or Oo A E O A E O A E O A E O A refers to a viral original sound on TikTok where a Turkish kid vocalizes a beat in the style of the game Friday Night Funkin'. The audio was uploaded to TikTok in October 2021 and went viral as an original sound. It was reuploaded a variety of times, becoming popularized among English-speaking TikTokers in 2022 as a goofy ahh sound.

Often accompanied by [[spinning cat_(meme)|]].

title: junko_(touhou)
body:
[i][[Touhou]][/i] character introduced as the final boss in [i][[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]][/i]. A divine spirit with the power to purify anything. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[orange hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[dalachi (headdress)|]] with a [[crescent]] moon on it and [[Chinese clothes]] with a [[red tabard]]. Behind her are [[multiple tails|multiple]] [[fox tail|fox tails]] made out of energy.

She is the embodiment of all hatred against the Lunarian race, especially [[Chang'e]], whose husband shot down the sun and killed Junko's son [[Bofeng]]. She is friends with [[Hecatia Lapislazuli]] who sympathized with her as she holds a grudge against Chang'e as well.

Unlike other Touhou characters, she has no in-game title. Her official profile simply says "(無名の存在)"/"(Nameless Being)" in place of a title, likely because she has purified herself of all identifying information.

h4. See also

* pool #10871 - Chang'e! Are You Watching?

h4. External Link

title: tohno_akiha
body:
Tohno Akiha is a character from the Japanese visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]] by [[TYPE-MOON]].

16 years old at the beginning of the story, Akiha is the head of the prestigious Tohno family and a student of the elite Asagami Private Girls Academy.

Her birthday is 22 September, while her blood type is A, height is 160cm, weight is 45kg, and measurements are B73/W57/H79. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[hairband]] and [[blue eyes]], Her clothing consists on a shirt with a [[bow]] and a [[long skirt]].

In the anime series, Akiha is voiced by Itou Shizuka while in the spin-off game [[Melty Blood]], she is voiced by Hitomi.

title: crown_(naked_king)_(nikke)
body:
[[Naked robe]] skin for [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]'s [[Crown (Nikke)|]].

According to [[Chime (Nikke)|]], this "outfit" was created to absorb Alva Particles, then converted into a weapon of mass destruction by a wandering monk. Due to nonexistent weight of the outfit, the wearer is completely unaffected by the thermal shockwaves it dispenses.

As the name suggests, this "outfit" consists only of a single [[white robe]] and an energy [[crown]] and nothing else, essentially leaving the wearer [[nude|naked]].  There are four [[floating hand]]s around the user to which they can be used to release an energy beam. For censorship reason, there are two x-shaped ray (explained in-game as the Alva Particle absorbed by this outfit) [[convenient censoring|covering the breasts and crotch]], though this is usually omitted in fanarts.

Very likely to be a reference to "The Emperor's New Clothes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Emperor%27s_New_Clothes
other_names: クラウン:ネイキッドキング

body:
An NPC in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. An operator that assists the Counters squad early on.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[short sidetail|short]] [[side ponytail]]. Wears a [[collared dress]] with a [[short sleeves]] [[crop top]] [[blue serafuku]] on top with a [[blue neckerchief]] and [[wrist cuffs]]. Her dress has [[pouch]]es, and she wears [[white socks]] and [[sneakers]].

Shifty is often the butt of jokes that question whether she is the real Shifty. This is due to [spoiler][[Syuen (nikke)|]] disguising herself as Shifty at one point in the campaign.[/spoiler]

title: icha_icha_(naruto)
body:
Icha Icha (イチャイチャ, English TV: Make Out) is a series of adult novels written by [[Jiraiya (Naruto)|]] after the commercial failure of The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi. The Icha Icha novels are based on Jiraiya's experiences in love, particularly his rejections by [[Tsunade (Naruto)|]]. When he's working on a new novel, he gathers "research" by peeping on women while they bathe. Teenagers are often curious about the books' contents, prompting their parents and other adults to go to great lengths to keep the books away from them.
Icha Icha is wildly popular, giving Jiraiya's checkbook a balance that is "filled with zeroes". [[Hatake Kakashi]] is a particular fan of the series; he enjoys reading the books even while in the middle of conversations.

h4. External links
* "Narutopedia: Icha Icha":https://naruto.fandom.com/wiki/Icha_Icha

title: needle_knight_leda
body:
[b]Needle Knight Leda[/b], is a character in [[Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree]]. She is a follower of [[miquella_(elden_ring)|Miquella]], and the character you meet in order to access the expansion.
While she never removes her helmet in-game, "official artwork of her":[/posts/7619575] without her helmet was released, showing she has [[blonde hair]] tied with a [[braid]]. Her face has since been compared to [[Saber_(fate)|]] from the [[fate_(series)|Fate franchise]].

[spoilers]Despite the cordial and friendly impressions she initially gives, it is revealed to be a facade once Miquella's charm is broken. Beneath her image of an ideal knight, she is highly zealous and viciously paranoid, eager to hunt her fellow seekers on the suspicion of disloyalty to Miquella.[/spoilers]

title: tube_top
body:
A [[strapless]] garment consisting of a continuous band of fabric across the torso, with the neckline stopping at the character's chest. Length ranges from covering the entire torso to just covering the breasts, or part of them; the latter two cases can additionally qualify as a [[bandeau]] or [[crop top]]. Traditionally, the only support they provided was due to the stretchiness of the fabric. Tube tops do not have any attached sleeves, meaning that they leave the shoulders/arms and upper chest area bare. Called [b]boob tube[/b] in British English.

A tube top made of [[bandages]] is referred to as a [[sarashi]].

Tube tops are innately strapless, thus should [b]not[/b] be tagged [[sleeveless]].

h4.Correct examples
* !post #7248894
* !post #5386478
* !post #7291818: Narrow length additionally makes it a [[bandeau]]
* !post #3622090: A [[bikini under clothes|bikini worn underneath]] a tube top
* !post #7491543: A tube top worn underneath [[suspenders]]

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #6610868: "Off-shoulder clothes" such as [[off-shoulder shirt]]
* !post #6445896: Held up by a [[halterneck]]
* !post #5248498: Held up by shoulder straps
* !post #5201509: [[Sleeveless]]
* !post #2871553: [[Strapless shirt]]

title: ichinose_shiki
body:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute category.

Shiki is a curious 18 y.o. girl who can be described only as "a mad scientist". She loves experiments, and is motivated by finding new things to hold her attention; if it's not interesting, she's not interested. Rather than being scouted by Producer, she chose him as part of one of her experiments. She sniffed the Producer and his smell convinced her that he was the right one for the experiment. She became an idol for this reason.

It's implied she uses pheromones to attract fans, and even in idol form, her hair looks messy and uncombed.

In the 11th Magic Hour SP, she revealed that she went to an American university before being an idol, but she got bored of it and returned to Japan. She attends a Japanese high school and lives on her own. She likes tabasco sauce and her forte is chemistry, but she dislikes wasabi and waking up early.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Shiki is introduced by [[Yanagi Kiyora]]. Her sniffing habits show up as early as her first line and her “Nyahaha” laugh appeared soon after. She seems to be friends with [[Sagisawa Fumika]] and [[Jougasaki Mika]], who both also know of her nose. Her smelling often causes her to fall asleep and she highly regards the Producer’s jacket as a source of soothing smells. Shiki got a job as a background character in a Wild West film.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th set of CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Shiomi Syuko]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Aihara Kotomi]] [藍原 ことみ].

title: god_force_(fate)
body:

[[Lu Bu (fate)|]]'s [[halberd]] and [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]]. It was designed by [[Chen Gong (fate)|]] and can transform into 6 different forms (known as "Forces"), [b]Slash[/b], [b]Thrust[/b], [b]Blunt Strike[/b], [b]Sweep[/b], [b]Parry[/b], and [b]Shoot[/b]. Due to his Mad Enhancement from being summoned in the Berserker-class, Lu Bu can only use the Halberd and Shoot functions.

It has been shown as a [[halberd]], a [[bow (weapon)|]] and [[arrow (projectile)|]], [[spiked gauntlets]], [[tonfa]]s, a broad[[sword]], [[kusarigama]], and a [[scythe|war scythe]].

[[Chen Gong (fate)|]] uses an [[arrow (projectile)|]] constructed from it when firing his Noble Phantasm [b]Two-Pronged Formation[/b].

title: ramesseum_tentyris
body:

A [[noble phantasm (fate)|]] possessed by [[Ozymandias (fate)|]]. It consists of several different temple complexes linked together, with the [[pyramid (structure)|]] Ramesseum serving as its center.

Featured in [[Fate/Grand Order]] by him trapping enemies by having two pyramids with the [[Eye of Horus]] on them slam together around enemies, meeting at the point.

Crashes onto [[Elizabeth Bathory (fate)|]]'s Csejte Castle in [[Halloween Comeback!]], and has [[Himeji Castle]] land on top of it in [[Halloween Strike!]], creating the [[Csejte Pyramid Himeji Castle]].

* [[Kondou Isami (fate)|]], Second Commander

* [[Harada Sanosuke (fate)|]], Tenth Unit Captain
* [[Ichimura Tetsunosuke (fate)|]]

[[Mini Nobu (fate)|]] also has a [[shinsengumi]] variant.

All Shinsengumi commanding officers possess the Noble Phantasm [b]Flag of Sincerity[/b], which allows them to summon additional members of the Shinsengumi, similarly to [[Ionioi Hetairoi (fate)|]]. In addition, all members possess the noble phantasm [b]Coat of Oaths[/b], which is their standard [[haori]] uniform.

title: meltryllis_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. Also known as [b]Meltlilith[/b]. She appears in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC Fox Tail]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She resembles [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a large black cloak, with [[long sleeves]] that [[sleeves past fingers|cover her hands]], and a metal [[crotch plate]]. Her most distinctive features are her metallic legs, which have long spikes that protrude from her knees and feet.

In [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], she is the aspect of BB representing pleasure, and she uses ballet techniques in her fighting style. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she appears as an Alter Ego-class Servant.

She is designed by [[Wada Arco]] and voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].

h4. Variants

* [[Meltryllis (Swimsuit Lancer) (fate)|]] (three distinct outfits: [[penguin hood]] [[jacket]]; [[frilled swimsuit|frilled]] [[blue one-piece swimsuit|blue]] [[off-shoulder one-piece swimsuit]]; [[frilled swimsuit|frilled]] [[white bikini]])

title: bb_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. She appears in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Appearance-wise, she looks like [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. 

In [[Fate/Extra CCC]], she is an advanced AI created by [[Matou Sakura (fate/extra)|]]. She is also the Master of the Sakura Five: [[Passionlip (fate)|]], [[Meltryllis (fate)|]], [[Kazuradrop (fate)|]], [[Violet (fate)|]], and [[Kingprotea (fate)|]].

[spoiler]Originally created as a friendly AI to aid masters who participatied in the lunar Holy Grail War. Due to a glitch in her coding, she has developed sadistic tendencies and later took over the Moon's electrical system. She often pretends to aid the players, only to put them in her own trap and mocking them of how powerless they are.[/spoiler]

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she is a MoonCancer-class welfare Servant for the Fate/Extra CCC event.

title: lionel_the_lionhearted
body: [b]Lionel the Lionhearted[/b] is a character and enemy in [[Elden Ring]]. He wears the iconic 'chubby' black steel plate armor with the wide-brimmed helmet. He uses a large rapier and casts death sorceries, should the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] choose to face him, and the other champions of [[Fia The Deathbed Companion]] within [spoiler]Deep Root Depths[/spoiler].

title: shadow_the_hedgehog
body:
One of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s rivals who first appears in [i][[Sonic Adventure 2]][/i]. Also known as "The Ultimate Life Form". He is a black hedgehog who was created by [[Gerald Robotnik]] 50 years prior and befriends [[Maria Robotnik]].

Shadow has a distant, at times borderline edgy personality due to his past, but has gained independence from it and will not tolerate wrongdoings against those he cares for. He wears hover shoes which help grant him the same level of speed as his rival Sonic, and has an immensely high rate of power increase when dispersing the inhibitor rings on both wrists and ankles.

His depiction in [[Shadow the Hedgehog (game)|the self-titled spin-off]] which has him wielding an actual firearms has solidified him as the archetypical "edgy" character within the series and outside of the community.

He is [[voice actor|voiced]] by [[Yusa Kouji|Yusa Kōji]] in the Japanese version, and David Humphrey, Jason Griffith, and Kirk Thornton in English titles.

h4. See also

* [[Super Shadow]]
* [[Doom Morph]]
* [[Terios (sonic)|]] (Beta Design)
* [[Lancelot (sonic)|]]
other_names: シャドウ・ザ・ヘッジホッグ

title: donald_trump
body:
[b]Donald John Trump, Sr.[/b] (b. June 14, 1946)

The 45th and 47th President of the [[united states|United States of America]] and US billionaire/businessman-turned-politician. Known for his reality TV show [i]The Apprentice[/i] in which the catchphrase "You're fired!" came from, and later as a Republican Party presidential candidate in 2016, becoming that party's official nominee.  His slogan during the campaign was "[[Make America Great Again]]".

Commonly depicted with [[blonde hair]], a [[red necktie]], and, occasionally unbecomingly, [[orange skin]].

title: hair_in_own_mouth
body:
When a character is [[mouth hold|holding]] a lock or single [[loose hair strand|strand]] of their own hair in their own mouth. Often used as a visual shorthand for derangement, e.g., on [[yandere]] characters, but also sometimes just used as a sign of general dishevelment.

See [[eating hair]] for when someone is chewing on someone else's hair. See [[stray pubic hair]] for when someone has pubic hair in their mouth.

title: long_hair
body:
Hair longer than the shoulders, up to reaching the waist. Shoulder length hair should be tagged with [[medium hair]] instead. 

Some characters may have [[very long hair]], which extends past the waist, or [[absurdly long hair]], which is longer than they are tall.

h4. Examples

!post #7352787: [[short hair|"Default" (short)]], [[short hair|short]], [[medium hair|medium]], [[long hair]].

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald girl]]
* [[very short hair]]
* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

h4. See also

body:

Depending on the game, they can be used as currency or to unlock extra levels or other content.

body: The act of [[swallowing]], [[eating]] or [[absorbing]] a [[planet]], be it by a character (i.e. [[Galactus]]) or natural phenomena ([[black hole]]s, [[star (sky)|]]s).

title: goblin_slayer
body:
The titular character and main protagonist of [[Goblin Slayer!|Goblin Slayer]]. Also known by his [[elf|elven]] name [b]Orcbolg[/b] (the mighty one).

He is almost always seen wearing [[full armor]] covering his entire body, and even when his helmet is removed his face is kept obscured, thus his full appearance is unknown.

He has an extreme hatred for [[goblin]]s [spoiler]due to his sister being captured, [[rape]]d, and killed by goblins while he could only hide and watch[/spoiler], and for that reason he decided to hunt down and kill all goblins in the world simply out of sheer spite.

h4. External links

* "Goblin Slayer Wiki: Goblin Slayer":[https://goblin-slayer.fandom.com/wiki/Goblin_Slayer]

title: sword_maiden
body:
One of the main characters from [[Goblin Slayer!]]. She is a priestess with proficient swordsmanship.

[spoiler]Formerly known as [[Female Bishop (goblin slayer!)|]]. In her past, she was captured by goblins who violated and tortured her. She was left permanently blinded and traumatically afraid of goblins. She eventually went on to join the party of heroes who slew the demon lord, as covered in the events of [[Goblin Slayer Side Story II: Daikatana]]. [/spoiler]
other_names: 剣の乙女(ゴブリンスレイヤー)

title: goblin_slayer!
body:
2016 Dark Fantasy light novel and manga, written by Kumo Kagyu and illustrated by [[Kannatsuki Noboru]]. An anime adaptation aired in October 2018.

The story follows the journey of the titular character known as [[Goblin Slayer]], an adventurer who hunts [[goblin]]s and only goblins. 

The anime adaptation also became controversial in the West after the airing of the first episode for retaining the extreme violence (including [[rape]] scenes) from the light novel not helped by at least one streaming site not properly labeling the series for said content.

title: knitting_needle
body: A large-sized [[needle]] that isn't sharp at the pointed end. Two are used in conjunction for the art of [[knitting]] by stitching yarn together to weave a piece of cloth. Knitting needles are sometimes erroniously depicted with a hook on the end similar to [[crochet hook]]s, but are distinct in that they have a constant thickness over their shaft, and don’t narrow right before the tip.

title: angra_mainyu_(fate)
body:
A servant first appeared in [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], being the first Avenger-class servant of the franchise.

While his true form is that of a pitch-black humanoid [[silhouette]], he is usually depicted with the body of [[Emiya Shirou]]. In this form, he has his hands and feet wrapped with [[bandages]], [[yellow eyes]], short [[black hair]], a [[red headband]], and [[full-body tattoo]]s.

Major antagonist in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. He participated in the Third Holy Grail War but was defeated. The [[holy grail (fate)|]] became corrupted as a result, turning it into the equivalent of All the World's Evils.

He appears as the irregular Servant Avenger in [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], replacing [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|]] as [[Bazett Fraga McRemitz]]'s Servant.

In the [[Heaven's Feel]] route of [[Fate/Stay Night]], he becomes [[Matou Sakura]]'s Servant.

Also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] in the Friend Point banner, being a unique 0-Star Avenger.

[b]True Name:[/b] Angra Mainyu, the evil god of Zoroastrian religion

h4.Ascensions

* [[Angra Mainyu (Third Ascension) (Fate)|Third Ascension]]

h4. See also

title: titanic_(movie)
body:
A 1997 romantic disaster movie directed, written, co-produced and co-edited by [[James Cameron]] about a fictional couple from different social classes who fell in love on board the [[RMS Titanic]] during its ill-fated voyage in 1912. Although based on real events surrounding the sinking, the story is fictionalized, focusing on said couple and people related to them, rather than the sinking itself.

title: enderman
body:
A neutral mob in [[Minecraft]], native to [[the end (minecraft)|The End]] while being able to spawn in all three dimensions. Endermen are tall black humanoids with elongated limbs, and purple eyes. Noted for their ability to pick up and move certain blocks such as dirt and flowers, disrupting a player's constructions. 

While being stared, Endermen will freeze in place and begin shaking before using [[teleportation]] to attack the player.  They will then teleport to the player and attack once the player looks away.  They have been compared to a [[Weeping Angel]] in this respect, though they do not remain motionless when in visual range.

h4. See also

* [[Ender Dragon]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links

* "Minecraft Wiki: Enderman":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enderman

title: shulker
body:
Light purple, box-shaped hostile mob in [[Minecraft]]. Only spawns in End Cities located in [[The End (Minecraft)|]] dimension. It fires specialized bullets that can cause an entity to experience [[levitation]] for a few seconds. Similar to the [[ghast]] [[fireball]], players can deflect that projectile. Has a [[teleportation]] ability. 

Once the shulker completely closes its shell, it becomes almost invulnerable to damage and can deflect [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

Shulkers have chance to drop their own [[shulker shell|shell(s)]], vital components to craft [[shulker box]]es.

h4. See also

* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links

* "Minecraft Wiki: Shulker":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Shulker

title: katsuragi_misato
body:
A character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] who is the chief operations officer at [[Nerv]]. She is the field commander for the [[Ayanami Rei|Eva pilots]] and guardian of [[Ikari Shinji]] and [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] who stay at her home.

[spoiler]Misato and her father were involved in the Second Impact as he was a top scientist who in the last moment put Misato in a escape capsule so she could survive the event. Afterwards Misato became [[crazy]] with survivor guilt and was admitted into a mental institution for most of her teenage years. After being released in her adult years she developed a very extroverted and cheerful personality to be able to cope with her past tragedies.[/spoiler]

Misato has a pet [[mutant]] [[penguin]] named [[PenPen]]; and she was the lover of [[Kaji Ryouji]].

title: princess_shokora
body:
The true ruler of the Golden Pyramid and the damsel in distress in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. Long ago she was peacefully laid to rest under the pyramid until the [[Golden Diva]], in her greed, took residence of the pyramid, all of its treasures and cursed the ruins, [spoilers]transforming Shokora into a [[black cat (wario land)|shape-shifting]] [[shop owner (wario land)|entity]][/spoilers].

She shares some design elements with [[Princess Peach]], having a golden [[crown]], [[blue eyes]], blue [[sphere earrings]], and a [[pink dress|pink]] [[long dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She also has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|reddish hair]] (more [[pink hair|pinkish]] in the in-game sprite), wears golden [[bangle|bangles]] and [[pink gloves|pink]] [[elbow gloves]].

[spoiler]Depending on the ending the design Shokora will transform into will differ. In the worst ending she turns into a [[baby]], in the second worst ending she has Wario's [[ugly woman|ugly face]], her second-best ending has her as the princess and her best ending reveals an older, more warrior-like princess with short hair. The second-best ending is seemingly her canonical look, as that's the look that got official art and appears in the newspaper at the beginning of the game. See asset #24265333 for a look at every form Shokora can take in the ending.[/spoiler]

The word Shokora derives from the French word for "Chocolate"

h4. Official Art

* !post #7517663

title: cute_weapon
body:
A cute weapon is any [[weapon]] that features a cutesy/girly aesthetic, with a popular color scheme for such weapons being [[pink theme|pink]]. The use of pink adds a cute or playful touch to something usually seen as serious or dangerous. This style is popular in some anime, games, and other media, where it adds a gap moe vibe to a character's gear.

title: knitting
body:
A hobby where yarn is thread together to create cloth by making little loops called stitches on a row, and then threading the yarn through these stitches on the next row while creating stitches for the next row, and so forth. Discernable from similar crafts by the use of two (or more) [[knitting needle]]s or a knitting machine. Knitted [[sweater]]s and [[scarf|scarves]] are made with this process.

h4. See also

* [[naalbinding]]

title: acerola_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Acerola[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

Rumored to be descended from an ancient Alolan dynasty, this Ghost-type Pokémon user serves as one of the Alola region's Elite Four [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Palossand]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[flipped hair|flipped]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[topknot]] with a [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[torn dress|torn]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[multicolored dress|and]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[dress]] with [[stitches]], an [[armlet]], and [[flip-flops]].

title: gardenia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Gardenia[/b], known as [b]Natane[/b] (ナタネ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This bold Gym Leader uses Grass-type Pokémon and is quite scared of ghosts and anything that surprises her. Her fear sometimes keeps her up at night [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Roserade]].

She has [[orange eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange]] [[two-tone hair|and]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a [[poncho]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[black shirt]] which is [[cropped shirt|cropped]] and bares her [[midriff]], [[torn shorts|torn]] [[cargo shorts]], a [[black belt]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[boots]].

title: candice_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Candice[/b], known as [b]Suzuna[/b] (スズナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This passionate Gym Leader has a fixation on focus. However, she sometimes wonders if she should play it cooler as an Ice-type Pokémon user [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Abomasnow]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] [[multi-tied hair|tied]] into [[twintails]]. She wears [[hairclip|hairclips]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[miniskirt|short]] [[brown skirt]], a [[blue sweater]] tied [[sweater around waist|around her waist]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: soulcalibur
body:
A fighting game series published by [[Namco]]. Compared to its sister series [[Tekken]], the series focuses on weapons combat and features more freeform 3D movement - a mechanic referred to as the "8-Way Run". The setting takes place in the late 16th and early 17th century and focuses primarily on the tales surrounding two legendary weapons, the eponymous [[Soul Edge (weapon)|Soul Edge]] and [[Soul Calibur (weapon)|Soul Calibur]]; the former is a corruptive weapon born of death that seeks to reap souls for power, while the latter is the diametric opposite and aims to destroy or otherwise stop its sibling.

title: irida_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Irida (English) / Kai (Japanese)[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon legends: arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

Irida serves as the leader of the Pearl Clan, and her partner Pokémon is [[Glaceon]].

As a leader, she feels it is important to have the courage to face the vast Hisui region without quailing before it. Though she is suspicious of you when you first meet, she will come to trust you thanks to the help you provide in quelling the noble Pokémon.

h4. Official Art

title: terios_(sonic)
body:
The original [[prototype design]] for [[Shadow the Hedgehog]]. 
One of the designs with a scar on his face would eventually be used in [[Sonic X Shadow Generations]] as an alternate skin, officially referred to as Terios, the name Shadow was going to have originally.

title: amano_nene_(vtuber)_(goddess)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[production kawaii]]'s [[Amano Nene (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #6409202.

It's a goddess-themed costume consisting of a gold [[circlet]] a [[white hood]], a gold [[neck ring]] a criss-cross a [[white bikini|white]] [[sling bikini top]] with [[gold chain]]s, [[white sleeves|white]] [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[detached sleeves]] gold [[bracelet]]s, a frilled [[underbust]] half leotard with a [[navel cutout]], [[white garter straps]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[high-low skirt|high-low]] [[showgirl skirt]] and wite [[leg ribbon]]'s giving the impression of [[barefoot sandals (jewelry)|]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulders]] decorated with small [[hair flower|flowers]] and the [[wing hair ornament|wing-shaped]] [[hairclip]] from her nun costume.

title: amano_nene_(vtuber)_(idol)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[production kawaii]]'s [[Amano Nene (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #6335381 and post #6082258. It's her official [[idol]] ouftif and her first 3D outfit, sharing a similar design theme with the other [[production kawaii|kawaii]] members idol outfits. It was designed by [[hane yuki]].

It consist of a [[high collar|high-collared]] [[cropped vest|cropped]] [[blue vest]] with a [[framed breasts|breast frame]] and [[fake wings]] on the back, an [[arm garter]], [[white gloves]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through hemline]] and a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[white thighhighs|white]] and [[blue thighhighs]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heel boots]].

Her hairstyle with this outfit is largely the same as her first outfit with the addition of [[pom pom hair ornament]]s and [[x hair ornament|crossed]] [[hairclip]]s on one side and a [[winged heart]] one on the other.

title: amano_nene_(vtuber)_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[production kawaii]]'s [[Amano Nene (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #6409181.

It consist of a either a [[crop top|cropped]] [[pink shirt|pink]] or [[grey shirt|frey]] [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[off-shoulder shirt]] with [[spaghetti strap]]s or a pink [[sleeveless turtleneck]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[heart cutout|heart]] [[cleavage cutout]] reminiscing of her 1st outfit, [[black shorts]] with [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]] [[panty straps|peeking out]], [[white socks]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an optional [[pink jacket|pink]] or [[aqua jacket|aqua]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[cross-laced sleeves]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is a [[ponytail]] with a [[wing hair ornament|wing-shaped]] [[hair bow]]. She can also mix and match with the hairstyles from her previous outfits.

title: amano_nene_(vtuber)_(nun)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[production kawaii]]'s [[Amano nene (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #5309473 and post #5092020.

It's a non-traditional [[nun]] habit consisting of a [[black veil]] a white [[detached collar|detached]] [[high collar]], a [[long dress|long]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress|black]] [[impossible dress]] with [[side slit]]s forming a [[pelvic curtain]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]] with [[sleeve garter]]s and [[sleeve cuffs]], [[white thighhighs]] held with [[legwear garter]]s and [[blue footwear|black]] [[pumps]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[medium hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] or [[long hair]] tied into regular [[twintails]] with [[sidelocks]] and a small [[wing hair ornament|wing-shaped]] [[hairclip]].

title: la_manchaland_(identity)_(project_moon)
body:
[[list of project moon Identities|Identities]] of [[Limbus Company]] Sinners extracted from mirror worlds where they were members of the La Manchaland's Bloodfiends, and kindreds of [spoiler] [[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|]]. [/spoiler]

They have no specific shared theme due to being responsible for separate parts of the La Manchaland amusement park, only having their [[white mask|white masks]] and [[red eyes]] due to being Bloodfiends in common.

* Outis' identity is based on the [[Nicolina (project moon)|]].
* Gregor's identity is based on the [[Curiambro (project moon)|]].
* Rodion's identity is based on [[Dulcinea (project moon)|]].
* Don Quixote's identity is based on [spoiler] [[Sancho (project moon)|]][/spoiler].

h1. Playable Identities:
* !post #8305366: The Barber of La Manchaland [[Outis (project moon)|]] (000)
* !post #8370684: The Priest of La Manchaland [[Gregor (project moon)|]] (000)
* !post #8438255: The Princess of La Manchaland [[Rodion (project moon)|]] (000)
* !post #8554540: The Manager of La Manchaland [[Don Quixote (project moon)|]] (000)

title: imca
body:
Character in [[Senjou no Valkyria 3]].

Imca (イムカ Imuka), also known as "Ace" or "Number 1," is a [[black hair|Darcsen]] heavy weapon specialist whose village was destroyed by the Valkyria and she is seeking revenge. No matter what the situation she always uses her prized weapon, [[var (senjou no valkyria)|Var]], which can be outfitted to suit all infantry classes. She is voiced by [[Asano Masumi]].

title: var_(senjou_no_valkyria)
body:
Trademark [[weapon]] of [[Imca]], Var is essentially a transformable [[gunblade]] which can change depending on which class Imca is set to.

See also:

* [[Senjou no Valkyria 3]]

title: red_arcueid
body:
A hypothetical [[dark persona|demented]] version of [[Arcueid Brunestud]], succumbing to her blood lust.

In the original [[Tsukihime]], she was completely identical to the original Arcueid. In the [[tsukihime_(remake)|remake]], her outfit differs by being the one from the original game but with [[side slit]] on her [[purple skirt]].

Also known as Warcueid (which comes from waru- (bad) + Arcueid, in the same line as [[Wario]], [[Waluigi]], etc...) or Bousou Arcueid.

title: star_wars:_republic_commando
body:
A first-person shooter game in the [[Star Wars]] series, first released for [[Xbox (original)|]] and [[computer|PC]] in 2005. The game has players take command of Delta Squad, a team of elite [[Clone Trooper]]s, and allows the player to give their squadmates orders. 

A series of 5 novels and several short stories and comics based on the game's characters were released, with the first book released several months ahead of the game in 2004. A sequel to the game was planned, but was canceled in the concept art phase. This sequel would've been titled [b]Star Wars: Imperial Commando[/b], and the title was reused for the final book in the novel series.

Despite the original game and books being removed from canon after [[Disney]]'s acquisition of the franchise, Delta Squad made a canon cameo appearance in [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]], and the concept of Clone Commandos has remained in the franchise through [[star wars: The Bad Batch|The Bad Batch]] and the playable Clone Commando class in [[Electronic Arts]]' Battlefront II.

h4. Characters

* [[Boss (star wars)|]]
* [[Fixer (star wars)|]]
* [[Scorch (star wars)|]]
* [[Sev (star wars)|]]

title: armpits
body:
The area of the body located underneath where the arm connects to the torso, often appearing when [[arm up|one]] or [[arms up|both]] arms are raised, especially when wearing clothes that are [[sleeveless]], [[strapless]], have [[detached sleeves]], have [[armpit cutout]]s, or if the character is [[topless]] or outright [[nude]].

[[Hakurei Reimu]] of the [[Touhou]] series is known for a meme involving her armpits since her dress does a lot to emphasize them.

Don't use when only [[armpit crease]] is needed.

title: mercuria_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Mercuria[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is a spirit healer that can see the flow of energy to help her clients deal with their problem. She is friends with [[J (reverse:1999)|Joe]], and also one of the main protagonist in the event "Floor It! To the Golden City", helping his gang finding the secret base the cult is using.

She is voiced by Sophia Delucchi in English and [[Anzai Chika]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7860443: Default
* !post #7860444: Insight II: The Universe Hold Its Breath
* !post #8524503: Midnight Mistmancer

title: j_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]J[/b], or [b]Joe[/b], is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. Leader of his biker gang in Haight Street, helping the unfortunate and protecting them. He is one of the main protagonist in the event "Floor It! To the Golden City", where he and his gang helped drive away a cult from their town. He has a bike and a big sword wrapped in white cloth, always hanging on his back. He is friends with [[Mercuria (Reverse:1999)|Mercuria]] and [[Pioneer (Reverse:1999)|Pioneer]].

He is voiced by Nick Monteleone in English and Kumagai Kentaro in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7749152: Default
* !post #7749154: Insight II: Top Speed Rider

title: purah
body:
Character in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]][/i]. A Sheikah researcher and [[Impa]]'s elder sister. Despite being over a century old, she appears as a 6-year-old child due to an age-reversing experiment.

In the prequel [i][[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]][/i], she is (apparently and actually) in her 20s.

In the sequel [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], she again appears to be in her 20s like in [i]Age of Calamity[/i], but with a different outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4161538: Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity
* !post #6399640: Tears of the Kingdom

title: master_sword
body:
The Master Sword, also known as the "Blade of Evil's Bane" is [[Link]]'s iconic weapon in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. It was forged by the Ancient Sages to vanquish beings of evil who would use the [[Triforce]] to wicked ends, and can only be wielded by those who are pure of heart and strong of body.

The Master Sword is a double-edged longsword with no fuller (central blade groove), and either a purple, gold or blue hilt, depending on the game. The hilt has a noticeably large cross-guard in relation to the pommel, and interestingly, it is somewhat reminiscent to the seal of the royal family. The blade has a large ricasso (unsharpened blade portion near the hilt suitable for a second grip), although Link is never portrayed using it in any of the games. Engraved on the blade is the Triforce, and embedded in the cross-guard is what appears to be a yellow gemstone.

h4. Official Art
* !post #971512

h4. See also

* [[sword]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: princess_zelda
body:
The titular character of [i][[the Legend of Zelda]][/i] series. Although the details of her background can vary in different games, Zelda is (almost) always depicted as the daughter of the royal family of Hyrule, and is the possessor and guardian of the [[Triforce]] of Wisdom.

Depictions of Zelda have varied over the years, but her most common character designs show her with [[blonde hair]] or [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]] or [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and a [[gown]] of white and lavender with gold accents, often decorated with [[Triforce]] symbols and other Hyrulian iconography. She is usually depicted as being the same age as [[Link]], the child protagonist of the games, or slightly older; a few games have shown her as a young adult woman.

h4. Appearance

title: video_crop
body:
Images sourced from video released by an artist. Such examples of source material include [[speedpaint]] or process-steps videos released by an artist or a captured video from a live stream. In general this type of image is not preferred unless a suitable version has not been published elsewhere by the artist.

When sourcing an image from a video, please leave a comment including how to access the video if not available from source and a time stamp from where the screenshot is taken. If sourcing from a video service such as YouTube the source can be a link to the video page; when available please using links that start the video exactly where the screenshot is taken.

Due to the nature of videos being almost universally [i]lossy[/i], it's preferred that final images be uploading as PNG (which would be [[lossy-lossless]]).

h4. Video cropping method

h6. Video players
Most common video players include functionality to save a specific video frame, as well as the ability to seek frame-by-frame.
* "MPC-HC":https://mpc-hc.org/ ([code]Alt+I[/code])
* "MPV":https://mpv.io/ ([code]S[/code])
* "VLC":https://www.videolan.org/ ([code]Shift+S[/code])
Browsers also contain such functionality, but it may not work on all sites (like Twitter, YouTube, etc.):
* "Google Chrome":https://www.google.com/chrome/ ([code]Right click video -> "Save video frame as..."[/code])
* [s]"Firefox":https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/ ([code]Right click video -> "Take Snapshot..."[/code])[/s] This appears to save the image as JPEG and as such should [b]NOT[/b] be used.

"yt-dlp":https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp can be used to download the highest quality video from many sites. You can then use the methods above to extract individual frames. For more fine-tuned control, [code]ffmpeg[/code] can be used:

[expand=ffmpeg instructions]
Instructions for Windows are as follows:
* Download the latest build: "FFMPEG Builds":[https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds/].
* Move the bin folder to C:\bin.
* Add C:\bin to the system path:
* Right-click "This PC" > "Properties" > "Advanced system settings" > "Environment Variables".
* Under "System Variables", edit Path and add C:\bin.
* Shift+Right Click within the folder containing your video file to open Command Prompt/Powershell.
* Extract frames with this command:
[code]ffmpeg -ss [START_TIME] -t [DURATION] -i [VIDEO_FILE] -r [FRAME_RATE] image-%03d.png[/code]

Format:

[START_TIME]: Start time (e.g., 4:00 for 4 minutes).
[DURATION]: Duration to capture (e.g., 3:00 for 3 minutes).
[FRAME_RATE]: Frames per second (e.g., 1).
Example:
[code]ffmpeg -ss 4:00 -t 3:00 -i video.mp4 -r 1 image-%03d.png[/code]
[/expand]

h4. Examples
* post #2701710 (sourced from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvhExE35b_U&t=550)

h4. See also
* [[end card]]
* [[anime screenshot]]
* [[eyecatch]]

title: help:blacklists
body:
[b]Blacklists[/b] are a way to hide posts containing tags you don't want to see.

To edit your blacklist, go to your "account settings":[/settings] under [b]My Account[/b] >> [b]Settings[/b] >> [b]Basic[/b]. You'll have to "create an account":[/users/new] if you don't have one already. In the [b]Blacklisted tags[/b] box, add the list of tags you want to hide.

Blacklisted posts are hidden during searches. When posts are hidden, a Blacklist option will appear in the sidebar showing you how many posts were hidden. You can click the tags under the Blacklist section to unhide blacklisted posts.

[[help:safe mode|Safe mode]] is another option if you just want to hide non-{{rating:general}} posts.

h4. Examples

Each rule goes on a separate line:

[code]
yaoi
futanari
guro
spoilers
[/code]
This will hide all posts that are tagged either [[yaoi]], [[guro]], or [[spoilers]].

If you put multiple tags on one line, then only posts that have [b]all[/b] the tags will be hidden:

[code]
yaoi guro
[/code]

This will only hide posts that are tagged both [[yaoi]] and [[guro]]. Posts that are tagged only [[yaoi]] or only [[guro]] will still be visible.

[code]yaoi 2boys
1boy[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged both tag [[yaoi]] and [[2boys]], also hide [[1boy]].

h6. NOT operator

The [code]-[/code] symbol is the NOT operator. It lets you hide posts that [b]don't[/b] have certain tags.

[code]
nude 1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged [[nude]] and [[1boy]], but only if they don't have the tags [[1girl]] or [[multiple girls]].

h6. OR operator

The [code]~[/code] symbol is the OR operator. It lets you hide posts that have [b]any[/b] of the given tags.

[code]
~1boy ~2boys
[/code]

is the same as:

[code]
1boy
2boys
[/code]

This can also be used to group together multiple complex rules into a single rule:

[code]
1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

is the same as

[code]
~1boy ~2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

h6. Metatags

There are a few special commands, known as metatags, that can be used to blacklist things other than regular tags:

* {{rating:explicit}}
* {{rating:questionable}}
* {{rating:sensitive}}
* {{rating:general}}
* {{status:pending}}
* {{status:flagged}}
* {{status:deleted}}
* {{score:<-5}} ([i]only less-than comparisons allowed[/i])
* uploaderid:1234 ([i]must be a user id[/i])

h6. Limitations

Wildcards are not allowed within blacklists. For example, using {{*boys}} to match the {{2boys}}, {{3boys}}, etc., tags won't work.

h4. Default Blacklists

The following blacklist is automatically set for logged out users and new users:

[code]
guro
scat
furry -rating:g
[/code]

h4. See also

* [[help:user settings]]
* [[help:safe mode]]

title: sword_of_kusanagi
body:
A sword which is currently in the Japanese royal Regalia, supposedly from mythical times. It is often depicted as a [[katana]] in fiction, however the most reliable images show it as a older form of short sword.

In the [[Touhou]] fandom, [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] is believed to have it in his antique shop and some artists depict it as his weapon of choice. Canon only states that it was discovered in [[Kirisame Marisa]]'s hoard and was renamed "Sword of Kirisame" "(霧雨の剣)":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E9%9C%A7%E9%9B%A8%E3%81%AE%E5%89%A3 in [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia]]. 

In [[The King of Fighters]] series, the main character [[Kusanagi Kyou|Kusanagi Kyo]] holds the weapon inside his body, so as to make him be able to wield flames and seal Orochi.

In the [[Len'en]] series, [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]] was born from Orochi's severed arm and because of this, [[androgynous|he/she]] has a connection with the sword, whose real name is [[Tasouken]] (蛇叢剣).

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kusanagi
* [[Kusanagi no Tsurugi (Fate)]]

body:

title: horizontally_flipped
body: When an image is horizontally reversed from what it 'should' be based on symmetrical details of a character's design, such as reversed [[heterochromia]] or being depicted as left-handed when they are right-handed in all other images. This tag is not for all cases of [[artistic_error|reversed heterochromia]], though, rather more strongly-evident cases where the following is likely to have happened: Artists often flip their work periodically while drawing to make sure it looks right from both perspectives and the angles of the lineart are not slanted, and such images may be a result of them forgetting to set it to the correct orientation before publishing. This is arguably distinct from [[artistic error]]s since it is not details [i]within[/i] the image that are incorrect, only the formatting of the image itself.

body:
A [[sword]] with a blade made of some sort of energy instead of a physical blade. 

The best-known example is the [[Star Wars]] [[lightsaber]], but energy swords are also very common in [[science fiction]] themed anime and manga.

Characters such as [[Kuwabara Kazuma]] from [[Yu Yu Hakusho|Yu Yu Hakusho]] and [[Vegetto]] from [[Dragon Ball Z]] are known for having energy sword attacks.

title: gummy_(arknights)
body:
[i]Gummy, Defender Operator of Rhodes Island, will heal her teammates while protecting them[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Lada[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 2[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A member of Ursus Student Self-Governing Group along with [[Zima (Arknights)|]] and [[Istina (Arknights)|]]. She and her group took refuge at Rhodes Island during the fall of Chernobog at the end of Episode One. A lively, kind, and pure girl. She always speaks from the heart and has a genuine desire to please everyone. In battle, she uses a frying pan as her weapon of choice and a vault door as her shield.

She is one of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Children of Ursus[/i].

Her motif is based on sun bears.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Takamori Natsumi]] (Japanese), Liang Ruixue (Chinese), Cristina Vee (English), Kim Chae-ha (Korean), and Varvara Sarantseva (Russian). Her illustrator is [[Skade]].

title: hornet_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class USS [i]Hornet[/i] (CV-12) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with [[Hornet (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CV-8]], although it is specified that Hornet II has the body and memories of the original Hornet but with Essex-class equipment and abilities. Character design by [[Kurumi (recycllamo)|]], voiced by Yamamoto Nozomi. h4. Appearance In her [i]Essex[/i]-class form, she retains virtually all of her [i]Yorktown[/i]-class dress attributes but with some updates. She is still portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]]. Her attire still consists of a [[black bikini|black]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]], a pair of [[short shorts]], and [[black thighhighs]], though she now gains [[thigh strap]]s above the thighhighs. She sports a pair of black [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] that stop right before the knuckle and have a yellow stripe along their length, as well as a dashing [[cowboy hat]], with a [[yellow belt]] and underside. Her [[black coat]] loses the number 8, however. Her [[rigging]] is now the same as the [i]Essex[/i]-class: a split [[flight deck]], one half on each side. * !post #5920479: Default * !post #5923684: [[hornet_ii_(racing_across_the_waves)_(azur_lane)|Racing Across the Waves]] (can be used with the original Hornet) h4. title: hornet_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the US aircraft carrier USS [i]Hornet[/i] (CV-8). Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by Yamamoto Nozomi.

Hornet's design differs markedly from her sisters on account of the fact that she was the first carrier built post-treaty. Instead of the white hair and silver/blue eyes of her sisters, Hornet has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]]. She is also more dressed down than her sisters. Her attire consists of a [[black bikini|black]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]], a pair of [[short shorts]], and [[black thighhighs]]. She sports a pair of black [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] that stop right before the knuckle and have a yellow stripe along their length, as well as a dashing [[cowboy hat]], with a [[yellow belt]] and underside. She has a long [[black coat]] similar to Enterprise, marked with the number 8 as well as her ship name. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of her [[flight deck]], missing the yellow markings of her sisters as well as the island superstructure combined with the flight deck. On the deck itself are 2 [[B-25 Mitchell|B-25 Mitchells]], a reference to the Doolittle Raid.

title: sword_of_st._catherine_(fate)
body:
The [[sword]] wielded by [[Jeanne d'Arc (Ruler) (fate)|]]. It belonged to "St. Catherine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catherine_of_Alexandria] that Jeanne never used while alive. She can use it to activate the suicide-type Noble Phantasm [b]La Pucelle: The Crimson Holy Maiden[/b], which can destroy anything in exchange for her own death. [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Avenger) (fate)|]] uses a blackened version of the sword.

h4. See Also

title: hood_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the battlecruiser HMS [i]Hood[/i]. 
Character design by [[Sa (h28085)|]], voiced by [[Tanaka Atsuko]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] worn [[hair over shoulder|over one shoulder]]. She is depicted as an elegant lady dressed in Edwardian fashion, wearing a [[medium dress|medium]] [[blue dress]], a [[capelet]] with a [[Union Jack]] pattern, [[ascot]], and a [[white headwear|white]] [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[hat]] with her real-life bridge. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of all four of her 381 mm twin gun mounts, two per side, with [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the tops of the lower turrets.

title: help:glossary
body:
h4. Introduction

In here you will find the meaning behind most of the terms Danbooru users use. This also covers terms of other sites relevant to the Danbooru.


h4. Dictionary

h5. User actions

* [b]1up[/b] - When a better version of an existing post is uploaded, especially if the existing version hadn't been approved yet and ends up deleted because the new one was better. Was commonly seen with Pixiv posts 1upping Twitter posts back when Twitter reduced the quality of images.

* [b]Gardening[/b] - Curating items by adding/removing/changing data, this term is usually applied to any edit action done in bulk, such as on:
** "artists":/artists
** "artist commentaries":/artist_commentaries
** "notes":/notes
** "pools":/notes
** "posts":/posts - This includes edit actions on posts other than adding/removing tags.
** "tags":/tags - Adding them to posts that should contain them or removing them to posts that shouldn't.
** "wiki pages":/wiki_pages

* [b]Sniping[/b] - When someone uploads an artwork with few tags in an effort to be the first uploader. This is usually frowned upon.

* [b]Mintagging[/b] - Tagging an upload with the bare minimum of tags or below; usually associated with sniping, but can also be a sign of laziness which is also frowned upon.

* [b]Nuke[/b] - Completely deleting a tag, usually done through a BUR.

h5. Users

* [b]Contributor[/b] or [b]Contrib[/b] - In a way, everyone who contributes to the site is a contributor, but this term refers to users whose uploads are automatically set as active ([[Help:Users]]).

* [b]Gold+[/b] - a short way of saying "Gold level or higher"

* [b]Janitor[/b] - This term usually refers to approvers ([[Help:Users]]). 

* [b]Moderator[/b] - Users at the Moderator+ levels, who moderate the actions of users ([[Help:Users]]). Be aware that many of the people who approve/disapprove posts are Approvers but are not Moderators.

* [b]Platinum-[/b] - A short way of saying "Platinum level or lower"

* See [[help:users]] for a list of the different levels.

h5. Posts

* [b]Appeal[/b] - If you think a deleted post is undeserving of deletion, you can appeal it ([[Howto:appeal]]).

* [b]Blacklist[/b] - Danbooru hides posts if they contain a tag from your blacklist ([[Help:Blacklists]]).

* [b]Purged[/b] or [b]Expunged[/b] - Usually deleted posts are still on the server, so they can be undeleted if there was a mistake, or blocked from being reuploaded if not. Expunged posts are completely erased and gone for good, for example, post #6. This usually only happens in extreme circumstances—for example, illegal content.
** [tn][b]Note:[/b] The primary reason this is not usually done is that it makes it possible to reupload the exact same image, which would now be unbanned/undeleted.[/tn]

* [b]Flag[/b] or [b]Flagged[/b] - if a post is low quality or breaks the rules, you can flag it for deletion ([[Howto:Flag]])

* [b]Hard Translated[/b] - When a translation is applied directly onto the image ([[hard-translated]]). Danbooru's notes system allows translators to put translations in boxes floating over the image without changing the file itself; this is called a [b]soft translation[/b].

* [b]Normalized Source[/b] - When Danbooru uses the data provided from specific direct image links to give you normal sources that take you to the original post, eg. <https://i.pximg.net/img-original/img/2019/08/19/05/04/43/76340480_p0.png> brings to <https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/76340480>.
** [tn][b]Note:[/b] This is only possible for sites where the original post is embedded in the image link somewhere.[/tn]

* [b]Parent[/b] and [b]Child[/b] - A way to group together different versions of similar posts, or related posts ([[Help:Post relationships]])

h5. Tags

* [b]BUR[/b] - Stands for "Bulk Update Request." By filling out "this form":[/bulk_update_requests/new], you can request one or more aliases, implications, or mass updates between tags.
** [b]alias[/b] - When two tags mean the same thing, one can be set as an alias of the other, so that the aliased tag gets automatically changed to the destination tag on every post using it, and searching for the aliased tag searches for the destination instead ([[Help:Tag aliases]]).
** [b]implication[/b] - When the presence of one tag will always mean a second tag should be added to the image, the first can be set to imply the second ([[Help:Tag implications]]).
** [b]mass update[/b] - Changing one or more tags. For example, [[kancolle]] -> [[kantai collection]] would remove [[kancolle]] and replace it with [[kantai collection]] to all posts which contain the [[kancolle]] tag.
** [b]rename[/b] - Renames a tag, moving all of its wiki and history data to the new name.
** [b]category[/b] - Changes the category of a tag. Required on all tags with a post count greater than 1000, or those going to or from the [b]Meta[/b] category.

* [b]Pet Tag[/b] - A tag created and maintained by a single user, which usually has narrow or confusing guidelines (for example arbitrarily omitting certain kind of artworks) and has low value to other users in its present state.

* [b]Qualifier[/b] - A word in parenthesis used as suffix for tags that have the same name, for example [[arrow_(projectile)]] and [[arrow_(symbol)]], or [[shimakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[shimakaze_(azur_lane)]]. Qualifiers are also used on artists that share name with other artists or tags, for example  [[hammer]] and [[hammer_(sunset_beach)]]. See [[help:qualifiers]] for more information.

* [b]Tag Script[/b] - Not an actual script! A special mode that users with Gold level or higher can use to add/remove tags from posts just by clicking on their thumbnails ([[Help:Tag scripts]]).

* [b]Umbrella Tag[/b] - A generic tag that several specific tags imply. For example, [[rose]], [[daisy]], and [[sunflower]] each imply [[flower]].

* [b]Utility Alias[/b] - An alias which doesn't move any post, made to improve searchability. For example, [[japanese sweets]] is aliased to [[wagashi]], because it's an uncommon word in english. This allows people to find the tag without having to google what japanese sweets are called.

h5. Other

* [b]+1/-1[/b] - "I agree"/"I disagree"

* [b]DMail[/b] - Private message (Direct Mail).

* [b]DText[/b] - Text formatting system used for comments and forum posts ([[Help:DText]]).

* [b]Feedback[/b] or [b]User Feedback[/b] ([[Help:User records]])

h5. Danbooru site

* [b]API[/b] or [b]API Key[/b] or [b]API Limits[/b] - If you use external programs with Danbooru (for example mass downloaders or userscripts), the API is how they communicate with the site. The API Key lets your program do things that require an account; using the key tells the site that it's coming from you. The API Limit is how quickly the program is allowed to do things on the site. This limit exists to reduce the risk of massive site vandalism. See [[Help:API]] for more information.

* [b]Booru[/b] - Danbooru is the name of both this website and the site's behind-the-scenes software. There are other websites that use the same software, older/modified versions, or software with a similar idea. Altogether these sites are called "boorus."

* [b]Safe mode[/b] - Danbooru's option to hide posts that are not rated general. Visit your account settings or use <https://donmai.moe>.

h5. Other sites

* [b]Rush Hour[/b] - Can refer to either the rush of artist uploads off-site or user uploads on-site, especially in the context of Pixiv for the former.
** [b]Pixiv Rush[/b] - Every day, Pixiv rankings reset at "00:00 JST":[https://www.google.com/search?q=00%3A00+jst&oq=00%3A00+jst]. Artists upload to Pixiv just after reset, so all views and favorites in the day count towards Pixiv's daily popular page. It's become enough of a tradition there that even artists who aren't popular or skilled enough to hit the popular page will still join the rush.
** [b]Danbooru Rush[/b] - Often times, as a Pixiv rush is happening or after it has happened, a flood of uploaders on-site will rush to upload them as fast as possible; can also happen beyond Pixiv if a particularly popular artist uploads art elsewhere. Also see Sniping under User Actions.

* [b]stacc[/b] - A page on Pixiv that shows the uploads (and optionally the favorites) of a Pixiv user (e.g. <https://www.pixiv.net/stacc/hmizuki>). The stacc name is also the login name of the user. Sometimes the stacc name can be used as a qualifier for the artist's tag, but it should be avoided. See [[Howto:Pixiv]] for more information.

h4. See also

* topic #17178 - Thread where glossary terms are discussed.

title: ace_combat
body:
A popular series of arcade  style flight action games published by [[Bandai Namco]] and developed by in-house team Project Aces. Initially named Air Combat as it’s Namco System 21 arcade original.

From the very first Ace Combat console game, the setting of the games take place in a world similar to Earth but with a radically different history, countries, geography, and having mixed existence of both real and fictional aircraft, as well as exponentially advanced technology, superweapons, submarines, and airships that are larger than life. This world is known as "Strangereal". Two major events have shaped many of the events of the mainline Ace Combat games: The [[ace_combat_zero|Belkan War]], and the [[ace_combat_04|Ulysses Impact]].

The typical Ace Combat plot follows a nameless/faceless fighter pilot's rise from a fledgling rookie to become a feared and respected ace in the war he is fighting, but told in narrative perspective of the people surrounding the pilot. The pilot in question will also typically face off against "rival" aces from the opposing nation. The music in the series has been composed by quite a few talented people within Bandai Namco sound team, with Tetsukazu Nakanishi, Hiroshi Okubo, and Keiki Kobayashi among them. Who also worked on other projects such as [[Tekken]], [[Ridge Racer]], and [[SoulCalibur]].

h4. Games
* Air Combat (1995)
* [[Ace Combat 2]] (1997)
* [[Ace Combat 3]]: Electrosphere (1999)
* [[Ace Combat 04]]: Shattered Skies (2001)
* [[Ace Combat 5]]: The Unsung War (2004)
* [[Ace Combat Zero]]: The Belkan War (2006)
* [[Ace Combat X]]: Skies of Deception (2006)
* [[Ace Combat 6]]: Fires of Liberation (2007)
* [[Ace Combat X2]]: Joint Assault (2010)
* [[Ace Combat Assault Horizon]] (2011)
* [[Ace Combat Infinity]] (2014)
* [[Ace Combat 7]]: Skies Unknown (2019)

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Ace Combat":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ace_Combat]

body:
A [[Nickelodeon]] animated franchise created by Brian Konietzko and Michael Dante DiMartino. The story is set in a world primarily influenced by Eastern culture and mythology (as well as Inuit), revolving around the reincarnations of the titular Avatar.

Not to be confused with [[James Cameron's Avatar]].

title: avatar_state
body:
In the world of [[Avatar Legends]], the Avatar State is a power that can be activated by the Avatar, granting them the collective power of all their past incarnations.

An Avatar in this state will have [[glowing eyes]]. In the case of [[Aang]], his [[glowing tattoo|tattoos will also glow]] as they represent lines of chi flowing through the body.

title: roku_(avatar)
body:
A character from the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise.

He was one of the previous incarnations of the Avatar, a powerful being who can control all four elements. He was a [[pyrokineses|Firebender]] who succeeded Avatar [[Kyoshi (Avatar)|]] and preceded Avatar [[Aang]]. As the immediate predecessor to Aang, he made several appearances in [[Avatar: The Last Airbender|The Last Airbender]], acting as Aang's spiritual mentor.

He is an [[old man]] with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]]. He wears a [[xiao guan (headdress)|]] and a [[red robe]] typical of the Fire Nation.

His animal guide was a dragon he named [[Fang (avatar)|]].

title: shirogane_naoto
body:
One of the main characters of [[Persona 4]]. An accomplished detective.

Naoto is [[androgynous]] in appearance, with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[grey eyes]] ([[blue eyes|blue]] in The Animation and Arena). She wears [[yasogami school uniform|Yasogami High's]] [[gakuran]]. Naoto is often seen wearing formal clothing such as blue shirts, ties, and her trademark blue [[cabbie hat|cap]]. She [[reverse trap|crossdresses]] to hide her true gender and her [[large breasts]].

Her Persona are [[Sukuna-Hikona (Persona 4)|]], [[Yamato Takeru (Persona)|]] and Yamato Sumeragi of The Fortune arcana.

Voiced by: [[Paku Romi]] (Japanese), Anna Graves (English, PS2 release, [[Persona 4 The Golden|Golden]], [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena|Arena]]), [[Mary Elizabeth McGlynn]] (English, [[Persona 4 The Animation|The Animation]]), Valerie Arem (English, all other appearances)

title: shoukaku_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shoukaku[/i]. 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

Her appearance is strikingly similar to [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], with the only major differences being her [[blue eyes]] and her [[white hair]] being done [[one side up]] while swapping out the hairband for a red spider lily. The sleeves to her outfit are elongated, however, meant to bear a resemblance to her namesake bird. 

While similar in ladylike design and apparently polite personality with her [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|Kancolle counterpart]], Azur Lane's Shoukaku is far more jaded and sarcastic, looking down upon her seniors and considering them fools for their failure at the Battle of Midway. In spite of her caustic attitude towards her "sempais", she does dote on her sister [[zuikaku_(azur_lane)|Zuikaku]] and the [[commander_(azur_lane)|Commander]].


h4. Appearance

body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Ookami Mio]], first featured in the [i][[hololive]] Idol Project 2019 Summer[/i]. While initially not having a name, the swimsuit was given the name [i]Summer Vacation[/i] in the [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] collab on late 2019 as a limited-time skin.

It consist of a [[two-sided jacket|two-sided]] [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] worn over a [[white bikini|white]] [[front-tie bikini top|front-tie]] [[bikini]] with a [[leaf print|leaf]] [[print bikini|print]] and a [[side-tie bikini bottom]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|shorts]] [[side slit shorts]], a black [[thigh strap]] and black [[high heels|high-heel]] [[sandals]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this swimsuit is [[very long hair]] tied into a [[wide ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]] and decorated with her usual eye glint [[hairclip]].

title: mach_rider_(character)
body:
[quote]YOU ARE "MACH RIDER"![/quote]

The titular main protagonist of [[Mach Rider]]. Riding a [[motorcycle]] mounted with [[machine gun]]s, he is Earth's last hope in fighting back against the invading alien forces as he searches for a new frontier. 

His trophy and music theme in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Melee[/i] gained him greater recognition. 

It is debated that Mach Rider is possibly a woman. This is due to [i]Vs. Mach Rider[/i], the arcade version, slowly reveals a skimpy woman holding a knife next to Mach Rider's bike the more levels you complete, with beating the final level revealing her fully[tn]"[1]":[https://www.vgmuseum.com/end/arcade/b/vsmachrider.htm][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://youtu.be/HNYmaLtm8_w?t=985][/tn]. This is further fueled by the Japanese gaming magazine "High Score" September 1986 issue, which had a pin-up poster of a female Mach Rider[tn]"[3]":[https://x.com/Shino4know/status/1365149590085894144][/tn][tn]"[4]":[https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EvFcrFYUYAIdSx3?format=jpg&name=orig][/tn], created by Yasuo Torai (虎井安夫) and Yasuhiro Kagami (鏡泰裕). No context was ever given who these women are, leading to speculation.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24255989: Cover Art
* !asset #24255993: Vs. Mach Rider
* !asset #24255995: Super Smash Bros. Melee

title: deep_bond_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]His name is a combination of his sire and grandsire's names. ([b]Deep[/b] Impact + Kizuna [b]"Bond"[/b]) [/tn]

Japanese race [[horse]]. Sired by Kizuna and foaled by Zephyranthes (by [[King Halo (racehorse)|]]). He is a brown horse with no leg markings and a large star facial marking. He is of the same owner as [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] as well as his contemporary.

He is infamous for ironically being a slow-natured horse. His "PuBo" nickname is also an expression of his slow nature[tn][i]-pubo[/i][/tn]. He also has another "Mo-i" nickname derived from a cry the horse allegedly made on camera, which was instantly picked up by the Internet for the cry being so un-horse-like (the "cry's" actual source is disputed).

He also happens to be Japan's racehorse with the highest earnings without any G1 wins, thanks to his 4 consecutive podium finishes at the Spring Tenno-sho (finishing 2nd, 2nd, 2nd and 3rd). While he surpasses [[Nice Nature (racehorse)|]] in earnings, races in the 2020's give significantly more earnings than races in the 1990's and Nice Nature ran more races in general. Deep Bond retired after the 2024 [[Arima Kinen]] and will become a leading horse at Kyoto Racecourse.

h5. Related
* [[Wada Ryuji]] - Main jockey
* [[Miyuki Hideaki]] - Main jockey, succeeded Wada

title: olivier_peslier
body:

Peslier retired on April 25, 2024.

title: fukunaga_yuuichi
body:

Fukunaga retired on February 2023 to become a horse trainer.

title: mirco_demuro
body:
Italian [[jockey]] based in Japan. He is infamous for his victory jumps and his love for [[nattou]] and other soy products, making him very memeable.

His brother, "Cristian":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristian_Demuro], is also a jockey.

If you see any of the below horses in their [[Umamusume]] form [[jumping]] like crazy or in [[midair]], praising nattou and/or eating nattou, they likely are references to him.

h5. Horses Mirco Demuro rode in his career

title: andou_katsumi
body:
Retired Japanese [[jockey]]. Initially, he was a jockey at Kasamatsu Racecourse, where he rode [[Oguri Cap (racehorse)|]] before the horse transitioned to [[Japan Racing Association|JRA]] races. He too would switch his affiliation to the JRA in 2003, where he was active for a decade before retiring to becoming a media commentator.

title: mermaid_(donkey_kong_64)
body:
An unnamed mermaid from [i][[Donkey Kong 64]][/i]. Found in the fourth world, Gloomy Galleon, she asks [[Tiny Kong]] for help to retrieve her stolen pearls from the Kremlings.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and sports [[large breasts]]. She wears [[blue eyeshadow]], a [[silver tiara]], a [[pendant]] and a blue [[shell_bikini|seashelled bikini]].  

Her character model is later reused in [i][[Banjo-Tooie]][/i] as decrepit statues in the Atlantis portion of Jolly Roger Lagoon
other_names: 人魚姫(ドンキーコング)

title: a-chan_(off-work)_(hololive)
body:
The 3rd and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[A-chan (hololive)|]]. This costume consisted of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket]] worn over a [[blue shirt]], [[black shorts]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]], she wore her hair in a [[low ponytail]] decorated with [[triangle hair ornament]]s. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7272669: Profile
* !post #7272681: Reference sheet

title: a-chan_(2nd_costume)_(hololive)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[A-chan (hololive)|]]. Revealed in May 2021, it replaced her [[A-chan (1st costume) (hololive)|original default]]. 

Going for a proper talent manager theme, her second costume consists of a [[black shirt|black]] and [[grey shirt|grey]] [[vertical-striped shirt]], [[black jacket]], black [[sash]], [[grey pants]], [[black footwear|black shoes]], and an [[ID card]] with a hololive [[lanyard]].

h4. Appearance

title: hermes_(mythology)
body: [[greek_mythology|Greco-Roman god]] who served as the herald of [[Olympus (mythology)|]], as well as the protector god of travelers, thieves, and merchant.

title: hephaestus_(mythology)
body: The Greek god of artisans, blacksmiths, carpenters, craftsmen, fire, metallurgy, metalworking, sculpture and volcanoes.

title: ares_(mythology)
body: The Greek God of War and Courage, one of the 12 [[Olympus (mythology)|Olympians]] and the son of [[Zeus (mythology)|]] and [[Hera (mythology)|]].

title: ares_(vtuber)
body:

She has [[medium hair|medium]]-length [[black hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes|red]] and [[green eyes|green]] [[heterochromia|heterochormia eyes]]. title: minato_aqua_(sailor)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Minato Aqua]].

It's based on a [[serafuku]] and consists of a [[white shirt|white]] short-sleeved [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[frilled sailor collar]] , a [[blue choker|blue]] [[ribbon choker]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[miniskirt]], reaching [[underbust|under her bust]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[open jacket]] with a [[cat hood]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]], she also now has [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]] with a [[tail ribbon]], she sometimes wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[baseball cap]] [[hat under hood|under her hood]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official ahairstyles]] in this costume
* [[Long hair]] tied in [[twin braids]] and a [[blue hairband]] or a [[bow hairband]] with an [[anchor hair ornament]]
* [[Medium hair]] cut in a [[bob cut]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4122196: Profile
* !post #5438691: Merchandise

body: The soul of [[Millenniumon]], represented by a [[crystal]] with a two-headed shadowy dragon within it.

title: ort_xibalba_(fate)
body: [spoilers]The end result of [[ORT (type-moon)|]] consuming many Servants, allowing itself to do something that’s supposed to be completely impossible: summon itself as a “Grand Foreigner” Servant after being killed.[/spoilers]

title: kendra_(rick_and_morty)
body: Kendra is an antagonist in [[Rick and Morty]]. Serving as the main antagonist of the episode Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion.

title: karen_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

A nerdy girl who enjoys reading and photography. Despite being ignorant to the various amoral topics covered in the visual novel, she is often seen as the most "normal" character in the cast due to her lack of negative traits.

title: lynn_hadley
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

She is the rather apathetic principal of the high school the visual novel is set in, as she cares very little for her students, as well as refusing to take action against the various immoral traits harbored within the faculty.

title: nicole's_mother_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

She is the mother of both [[Nicole (class of 09)|]] and Gamer Brother (nickname given by Nicole; his real name unknown).

title: kelly_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

Kelly is an extroverted and lively girl, who usually gets along with a majority of the cast, unless she is threatened or insulted. She works as the part-time manger of the FYE at the local mall, in which she takes her job very seriously, as seen in some routes.

title: ari_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. She becomes the deuteragonist for some of the routes featured in [b]The Re 'Up[/b].

Ari is a timid and reserved girl who struggles with various issues such as self-harm, depression, and her closeted feelings towards other girls, stemming from her fears of her orientation being known by the school. In some routes, she can enter a rather unhealthy relationship with [[Nicole (class of 09)|]].

title: aleste
body:
A series of popular [[science fiction]] shooting [[video game]]s by [[Compile]].

The [b]Aleste[/b] franchise started in the 80s with the first game of the same name released for the [[Sega Master System]] as [b]Power Strike[/b] in 1988.

They usually feature (an) attractive ace female pilot(s) riding a flying combat [[mecha]] or a [[starfighter]].

title: bleach
body:
A very popular long running shounen manga and anime series by [[Kubo Tite]]. 

The story revolves around [[Kurosaki Ichigo]], a young man who became a [[shinigami]] after his encounter with [[Kuchiki Rukia]] and his adventure into the afterlife and beyond.

h4. Sagas

In roughly chronological order:

* [[Bleach: Turn Back the Pendulum|Turn Back the Pendulum]]
* [[Bleach: Memories of Nobody|Memories of Nobody]] (filler)
* [[Bleach: Zanpakutou Ibun Hen|Zanpakutou Ibun Hen]] (filler)
* [[bleach: sennen kessen-hen|The Thousand-Year Blood War]]
* [[Bleach: Epilogue|Epilogue]]
